email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Shipping Road Salt
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Benson,

I’m hoping to ship 20,000 MT of road salt from Narita Airport to Buffalo. Do you charge a holding fee for storing the cargo before it’s picked up? Additionally, could you provide details on your insurance policy costs per container and per mile? Also, what would be the premium on 1,200 MT of salt?

Thanks,
Lloyd

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Shipping Road Salt
email_chain.body:
Dear Lloyd,

I received your email on my cell phone at 6:00 PM today and called you as soon as I arrived home. If I hadn’t had your phone number, I wouldn’t have been able to reach you. It’s unfortunate that our systems don’t communicate effectively. What if you hadn’t been available when I called?

Is there any way we can improve our communication systems, perhaps by sharing phone numbers or ensuring our email systems are better integrated?

Sincerely,
Dr. Benson

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Salt Order
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Benson,

Since you received my email yesterday morning at around 7:30 AM, I assumed you’d be able to assist with my salt order. I called your office at 11:00 AM yesterday but received no answer, so I left a voicemail. Did you receive my email, or are you unaware of it?

I called again at 3:30 PM, and you answered this time. I left another message, which I suspect you haven’t listened to yet. The main point of my message was that I’m very dissatisfied with the lack of response to my emails and the delay in returning my calls.

To clarify, my frustration stems from your failure to reply to my email and the hours it took for you to call me back. I’m unsure whether you’re intentionally ignoring my requests or if there’s a communication breakdown.

Regards,
Lloyd

email_chain.subject: Methyl Alcohol Supply Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Martinez,

We are planning to add methyl alcohol to our supply chain from Nanjing to New York in approximately two weeks. Could you confirm if 4,000MT is a feasible quantity? Additionally, would you be able to provide the sea transport cost for 10,000MT within the same timeframe?

Kind regards,
Chris Green

email_chain.subject: Re: Methyl Alcohol Supply Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Green,

Please find attached the invoice for the 4,000MT of methyl alcohol as agreed. Could you confirm if this meets your requirements, or if you would like to adjust the quantity? Also, I am looking into the cost for transporting 10,000MT and will provide you with that information as soon as it is available.

Best regards,
Maria Martinez

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Options and Demurrage Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Carter,

I need to import 20,000MT of automotive oils from Lianyungang to Ras al-Khaimah. I have two options:

1. A 45-day sailing from Weihai to Jebel Ali via Singapore, using 3 containers (six of 400MT each).
2. A 45-day sailing from Qingdao to Fujairah via Algeciras, Cartagena, and Singapore, using one 45′ container (five of 500MT each).

Could you provide the options you have for both sailings and the total demurrage at the destination?

Regards,
Amanda

email_chain.subject: Request for New Shipping Options and Demurrage Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Carter,

I am currently receiving supplies from Singapore and Amman. However, the current port is too far from the client, and I need to reduce delivery time. I have the following shipments:

1. Two 40′ containers (200MT each) from Singapore to Ras Al Khaimah via Jebel Ali and Doha.
2. One 40′ container (200MT) from Amman to Fujairah via Jebel Ali and Doha.

Could you provide the options you have for both sailings and the total demurrage at the destination?

Regards,
Patrick

Sincerely,

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Qinhuangdao trip, Dec 2nd
email_chain.body:
OK, so I need to round up 3 people for the Qinhuangdao trip tomorrow and I am waiting for the third one to come through.

010-68102088
Patrick, 13832066888

email_chain.subject: Re: Qinhuangdao trip, Dec 2nd
email_chain.body:
Hi Patrick,

I'm fine. Sorry for my late response. Thanks for the advice, I've already quit it 6 months ago, as it was just too expensive.

The dump will be finalized for $19 on Monday. But the requirement of 2 laptops is quite strict. It's very cold and too windy there.

The couple in the above message is from Tokyo, so please don't feel sorry for him.

We will come to B Air again by Jan 5. Thanks very much for all your help!

I will try to email you on the next trip if I need some help again. Please let me know if you need anything from me.

Hey, we will try to book a taxi to Hangzhou and shuttle bus to B Air from there. You are welcome to come and visit us if you're around.

email_chain.subject: Capacity Inquiry for Epoxy Shipment
email_chain.body: Mr. Qiu, do you still have capacity for this shipment of 4,200MT epoxy from Qingdao to Hong Kong? We need to firm up the rate within three days, please. Thanks, Gerald

email_chain.subject: Freight Bill Adjustment
email_chain.body: Ms. Qi, last week you had a freight bill from you to me. Thank you. We agree with you. So the China export CFR price to Hong Kong at $700 per metric ton in total. However, you should reduce the weight for the two bls of garbage bags and four empty pallets. Please check the weight of other 4,180 tons. In the end the total price should be $682/MT. Can you kindly confirm for me the final price? Thank you. Gerald

email_chain.subject: Availability for Meeting
email_chain.body: Hi Margaret, it's Marlene. I just wanted to give you a quick call to discuss whether you are still available for my brother's meeting with an employer on April 17. I talked with Mary and she is also available if you are, so I hope you are good for both of you. Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Availability for Meeting
email_chain.body: Thank you for your message, unfortunately, we will not be able to make it this time. I am extremely busy at work, but please do let me know if anything changes and I will do my best to make it happen.

email_chain.subject: Quote Request for Furniture and Lamps Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Gerald, I am doing great, hope you are doing well. I was just wondering if I can get a quote for a shipment of 2,900 MT of furniture for VITRA from Qingdao to Hong Kong. They want the shipment by April 25th. We have already opened up a truck and will be paying it off in April. We are also getting 2,400 MT of lamps from Qingdao to be delivered at the same time. Can we get a quote together please? Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Advice on Importing Commodities from China
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Galloway,

I know you are working in China, so I would like to seek your advice about importing commodities from China. Could you guide me on how to source these commodities and where to find reliable data for prices, delivery dates, and duty implications?

With best wishes,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Mr. Gupta's Reference
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to follow up on our earlier correspondence regarding Mr. Gupta of Gurmeet Gupta & Co. It has been over six months since Mr. Gupta and I last met, and we have been in touch since then. I am writing to inquire if you still have any goods that you wish to place with Mr. Gupta. If so, please let me know as soon as possible. Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,
Mr. Galloway

email_chain.subject: Re: Advice on Importing Commodities from China
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Michael,

I hope you are doing well. It was a pleasure meeting you, and I trust you enjoyed your time in China. I would be delighted to support you during your future visits. To gain deeper insights into China’s trade environment and business practices, I recommend visiting again. Please feel free to contact me for more details or advice. I am also forwarding a list of our current clients for your reference.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Mr. Galloway

email_chain.subject: Quote for Oil and Gas Loading from Los Angeles to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Kurpakoff,

I’m reaching out regarding your request for a quote on an oil and gas shipment from Los Angeles to Singapore. We understand the tight deadlines and are working diligently to provide you with the best offer possible. Currently, we are 48 hours away from finalizing the quote, but the timeline is tight due to the specific requirements and vessel availability.

We are considering the container ship M/V Santa Rosalia, but its ETA to Los Angeles is still undetermined. Once we have a firm ETA, we can proceed with the details. Please let us know if you have any updates on the vessel's schedule.

Thank you for your understanding, and we will do our best to meet your needs.

Best regards,
Logistics Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Oil and Gas Loading from Los Angeles to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Logistics Team,

Thank you for your prompt response. We are indeed under a tight deadline, as we need to deliver the cargo to our end customers by mid-June. The order was only confirmed last Friday, which has put us in a challenging position.

We are currently coordinating with the charter company to expedite the arrival of the M/V Santa Rosalia to Los Angeles. The vessel is currently in Shanghai, and we are pushing for an earlier ETA. If you have any updates on the vessel's schedule, please let us know.

We appreciate your efforts and look forward to your final quote.

Best regards,
Yuri Kurpakoff

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Oil and Gas Loading from Los Angeles to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Kurpakoff,

We have reviewed the market conditions and are presenting you with the current contract price for your bulk oil cargo shipment from Los Angeles to Singapore. While we are still monitoring the freight market for better offers, this is the best deal available at the moment.

If a more competitive offer arises, we will notify you immediately. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we navigate these tight deadlines.

Thank you for your continued trust in our services.

Best regards,
Logistics Team

email_chain.subject: Financing Inquiry for Freight Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Kurpakoff,

I am reaching out to inquire about your willingness to provide financing for the freight shipping of crude oil from the U.S. West Coast to China. Could you please provide your current interest rate, payment terms, maximum loan amount, and payment period? We are looking for terms that are more flexible than those offered by traditional financial institutions.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Jordan Diaz
MSS Corporation

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Shipping Products
email_chain.body:

Thank you,

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Expected Arrival of 700MT Kerosene Shipment
email_chain.body:

Sincerely,
George

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on 700MT Kerosene Order
email_chain.body:
Dear George,

This is a follow-up regarding our order of 700MT of kerosene. Please let me know if there are any problems with the shipment, and let me know if you have any questions about the products.

Regards,
Kyle

email_chain.subject: Feedback on Recent Communication
email_chain.body:
Mark,

In my experience as an executive, sending out a clear, well-structured email is important in communicating your message to the right audience. Your recent message to the sender of the cargo was one such example. The structure was clear and concise, making it easy for the receiver to understand. The only mistake you made was to address the receiver using their first name rather than the title of their position. You could have easily addressed him as “Mr. George”, but I guess you wanted to be more informal. Regardless, the main message was conveyed and you managed to make the whole process as straightforward as possible.

Regards,
Eko

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipping from Aqaba to Eilat

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipping from Aqaba to Eilat

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Soft Drum Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Lewis,

I was reviewing the latest tables on your website and noticed that you have suddenly dropped the soft Drum Rates. Could you share your rationale for this change?

Best regards,
Geoffrey

email_chain.subject: RE: Soft Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Geoffrey,

Thank you for your inquiry. The soft (best match) rate was adjusted to -50% because, upon reviewing the data, we found that there are no applicable soft (best match) rates currently available. For more details, you can refer to the explanation of soft (best match) rates in the history of the Band Memberships Section.

If you would like to apply the current personal rate of -50% to your account, please email me for your personal ID number, and I will update your account accordingly. If you are interested in the new rates, which are listed below, please consider adding your personal rate as a donation to support our services.

Best regards,
Howard F. Lewis

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santos,

We have a shipment of rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin that needs your attention. Are you available to confirm a June laycan? And can you advise me on the cost, given the short lead time?

Yours,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your note of May 14.

We’ve just confirmed a June 25 departure for Benin. The shipping company has told us the cost is $____. That includes ocean freight, U.S. port to Japanese port, customs clearance in Benin, and trucking the rice to the Beninese port, as agreed. We’ve also made all necessary payments, and we’ll send you a bill soon. Are you planning to import rice on behalf of your client? Or are you going to ship it from your own warehouse in Benin?

Regards,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message of May 19.

We’re going to import the rice on our own behalf, as we do most of our food imports. We’ll buy a few trucks for transportation to the port from the best Beninese sources we can find. We’ll also take care of clearance at the port and of any potential legal issues, as we do. Is that enough information for you?

Regards,
Mr. Santos

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin
email_chain.body:
Glad to hear that.

We’ve made an advance payment to your company for the rice shipment. Could you check with the shipping company about the precise routing of the shipment?

Sincerely,
T. Watkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin
email_chain.body:
Dear Watkins,

Thanks for the message. The shipment of rice has now departed Yawata for Manila. It will take 4-6 weeks from Manila to Benin. No delays anticipated. I have advised our supplier of the change.

Yours,
Matsuo

email_chain.subject: Request for Rate Quote - Korea-Singapore-Indonesia Route
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Hope you’re well, and thanks for your message.

I’ve reviewed your vessel itinerary, and it aligns well with our needs. However, I’m not seeing any rate quotes for the Korea-Singapore-Indonesia route. Could you please provide a rate quote for 5,200MT next month, along with any applicable surcharges?

Thank you again.

Best regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up Questions on Charter Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Thank you for your message and the quote you provided. Before proceeding with the charter, I have a few questions:

1. What is the service speed on the route?
2. What are the cruising conditions?
3. Are there any consumption fees? If so, what is the cost per unit (e.g., Diesel $100 per MT, Fresh Water $100 per MT)?
4. Are there any berthing charges? If yes, what is the amount?
5. Does your price include all charges? Please confirm if any of the following apply:
   a. Additional costs for port dues, anchorage fees, etc.
   b. Any other additional costs.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Request for Rate Quote - Singapore-South Korea-Singapore Route
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

I understand that you have availability in August and September for the Singapore-South Korea-Singapore route, carrying 5,200MT. Could you please provide a rate quote for these two routes? I am looking for a commitment in August with the possibility of extending into September. Please confirm if this is feasible.

Your quote should include:
A) Consumption of bunker fuel, crew wages, and all related costs.
B) All other costs, including port charges, mooring costs, fuel, and other port operation-related expenses.
C) Miscellaneous fees, including crew wages and other fees.
D) Any additional costs or fees that may apply.

I hope this clarifies our requirements. Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for 2-Year Period
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Kim,

I am sending you a charter inquiry for a 2-year period covering Singapore, Korea, and Indonesia. Please refer to the details below:

- The vessel must have a capacity of 5,000 DWT with 100% cargo stowage.
- A minimum of 35% cargo space must be available for storage.
- The vessel must accommodate 70-75 crew members.
- The ship must have a clean deck and hold.
- Please confirm if there is a fuel surcharge applicable.

We would like to ensure that all requirements are met before proceeding. Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Kate

What are the costs like for custom clearance at the port, and any other extra costs in particular? Best,
Gloria

email_chain.body:
Hello Ryan,

How are you?

I am writing again because I have not heard from you, and the Shoutzu representative there in Durban has had a few unfortunate experiences with my previous 1 container of frozen beef. This made me wary of trying to send the container via your agents. I'd like to know what happened and if you have some suggestions on how we could proceed.

If you have any advice or opinions regarding this, you may advise me.

Kind regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Concerns Regarding Previous Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Gloria,

I received your email.

I received an offer on the Tender in Japan, but I am getting some response from Mr. Nakano at Asahi Kasei. We hope to resolve this soon and will keep you informed.

Please see my invoice #461664 from Durban for your file. I enclosed the estimate on getting your vessel through customs with me. On my return from overseas next week, I will put a formal quote on that with you. Before that, you will need to make some payment toward the terminal charges as we have had delays in getting your containers discharged, but that has now been rectified, and the documents are on their way through.

Best regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Original question
email_chain.body:
Hello Mateo,

I am working on a college assignment and would appreciate your help. Here is the problem and my proposed solution. Could you please review it for me?

```
if (data < 200)
    print "data is low"
else
    print "data is high"
```

Thanks in advance,
Chapman

email_chain.subject: Respond to email
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Chapman,

I hope the issue has been resolved. If you have any further questions, feel free to ask. Here’s an example of how to implement a loop in a script:

```
for (i = 0; i <= 10; i++) {
    print i
}
```

Best regards,
Mateo

email_chain.subject: Thank you for helping me
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Mateo

Eddie

Thank you for your email of today. I have arranged with the local office to send me a letter confirming our agreement to the effect that you have the requirement for us to load 600 tons of fertilizer. We will contact you for further details once we have them.

Eddie

Best wishes,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Oil Spill Clean-Up and Dispersant Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Ambrose,

I hope this message finds you well. I was in the Gulf of Mexico over the weekend and observed the ongoing clean-up efforts. As you are likely aware, there was a significant oil spill this summer, and I wanted to provide some context on the scope of the issue. I have included an infographic and a table to help illustrate the situation.

We estimate that we will need at least 40,000 tons of chemical dispersants to aid in the removal of the oil spill. The next step will be to contain the crude oil and distribute it to companies that have placed orders for oil. It's worth noting that major oil companies like Chevron are already involved, with Chevron reportedly handling 40% of the oil being recovered from the Gulf.

I am reaching out to inquire about the availability of dispersants and how we can facilitate their procurement. Additionally, we will need to ensure that the necessary vessels are on-site to support the operation.

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Oil Spill Clean-Up and Dispersant Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thank you for your email. Could you provide more details on the types of dispersants you are looking for? It would be helpful to have an infographic or a list of the specific chemicals you are considering.

Additionally, when discussing crude oil and dispersants, how do you plan to control the dispersal path of the product once it is applied?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Ms. Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Re: Oil Spill Clean-Up and Dispersant Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Ambrose,

Thank you for your questions. We currently have a stockpile of dispersants in storage, and they are ready for dispatch. The dispersal pathway is controlled by introducing the dispersants into the water column, either through chemical dispersants or in-situ burning. While in-situ burning has been tested in some cases, it is not yet fully approved and will undergo further testing.

The main challenge with chemical dispersants is controlling the depth and concentration within the water column. In-situ burning, on the other hand, allows for better control over the depth of the burn, although it comes with its own set of challenges.

Please let me know if you need any further details.

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: City's Five-Year Goals and Priorities
email_chain.body:
Hello Commissioner Kennedy,

The local Chamber of Commerce has put together a list of goals for our city over the next five years. I’m helping them put these plans together and would like to discuss our business priorities with you.

I have attached our list of goals, and I look forward to our meeting.

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Thank you,
Kevin W. Murphy

email_chain.subject: City's Five-Year Plan
email_chain.body:
Dear Commissioner Kennedy,

I am happy to report that our city has a strong plan for the next five years. We have many ideas for our future. We believe that we will achieve our goals if we work together and make a commitment to our city.

I have attached our goals to this email. They are very specific, but we hope that you agree with us that we will make our city a better place to live.

I look forward to meeting with you and hearing your suggestions.

Best Regards,
President of the Chamber of Commerce

email_chain.subject: Input on City's Five-Year Plan
email_chain.body:
Dear Commissioner Kennedy,

I know that you are currently a Commissioner of the City Council. I am the mayor of our city and would like to get your input on our city’s five-year plan.

We have identified several problems that we would like to address over the next five years. I believe that our goals are achievable if we all work together.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

Best,
Mayor

email_chain.subject: Discussion on City's Five-Year Goals
email_chain.body:
Dear Commissioner Kennedy,

I hope this email finds you well.

As the new chairperson of our city council, I have been working very hard to make our city a better place to live. I believe that our goals will bring positive change to our city over the next five years.

I would like to discuss these goals with you and hear what you think.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Chairperson of the City Council

email_chain.subject: Re: Input on City's Five-Year Plan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mayor,

I have had the opportunity to read through your city’s five-year plan and would like to discuss it further. Please let me know a convenient time for a meeting.

Best regards,
Commissioner Kennedy

0415 461 923

Physical and financial risk management, Sea and air freight services, customs declarations and physical transit from factories to port. 100% reliability, fast and cost-effective.

email_chain.subject: Discrepancies in Consignment Delivery to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear [LCL Operator],

I have double-checked the items in the consignments listed below that you delivered to Colombo in your last shipment. In all cases except one, there is no correspondence in the booking with the actual delivery to the consignee. In some instances, the invoices are not attached to the delivery notes. We are therefore unable to pay you and ask you to take note of the following:

1) Invoice number: [missing], date of delivery: [missing], does not correspond with the consignments listed below. (The delivery notes were attached to each consignment, and they show the same invoice number).
2) Invoice number: [missing], date of delivery: [missing], does not correspond with the consignments listed below. (Delivery note shows a different invoice number).
3) Invoice number: [missing], date of delivery: [missing], does not correspond with the consignments listed below. (The delivery notes are incomplete).

Please address these discrepancies at the earliest.

Best regards,
Farah

email_chain.subject: Chemical Spill at Railyard
email_chain.body: Hello, my name is Jane Doe and I work for ABC Supply in Virginia. I am writing to inform you about a significant incident. On 22 September 2013, during a training exercise, a chemical spill occurred. Tank cars derailed and released 100,000 lbs. of a mixture of chemicals into the Kanawha River. Governor Tomblin has declared a state of emergency for Jackson and Kanawha counties. Additionally, the Cosco Kuwait will be out of service this weekend. Please advise if vessel space is available.

email_chain.subject: Chemical Spill
email_chain.body: As you are aware, on 19 November 2013, a chemical spill was released into the Kanawha River in West Virginia. Since the spill, the Kanawha River is non-navigable, and the operators of the oil terminal in Point Pleasant are requesting permission to release the contents of the terminal into the creek. Additionally, the Virginians for a Natural Gas Free America group is urging the declaration of a state of emergency and seeking to shut down the Dominion Natural Gas Pipeline that connects the Richmond area to a compressor station.

email_chain.subject: Request for BTI Pulp Weight and Freight Adjustment
email_chain.body:
Hello Dr. Moreno,

Could you send me the weight of 8,000MT of BTI pulp that arrives at Damen via Colombo, Panama, and Suez on May 21st? Also, are you open to adjusting the freight for May 10th?

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Update on Panama Canal ET
email_chain.body:
Dr. Moreno,

I wanted to share the results from the Panama Canal. The ET is currently at 31 hours, so I'm assuming we'll have an early arrival in Colombo. I'll keep you updated when I know more.

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for BTI Pulp Weight and Freight Adjustment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

Thank you for the update. We haven't seen a favorable ET through the canal for that day, but we’ve placed a container there as a backup. The good news is that we can offer you a smaller volume of BTI pulp with shorter ETs. We haven’t requested any payment adjustment for this, but if you’d like to propose one, we’ll review it and determine the most feasible solution.

Please let us know if you have any updates for the early departure on the 10th and 11th.

Sincerely,
Dr. Moreno

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for BTI Pulp Weight and Freight Adjustment
email_chain.body:
Hi Dr. Moreno,

Thank you for your reply. That’s great news! We’re interested in the deal, but I can’t confirm anything until we know the exact volume we can send on that ship. We’re still waiting for a container from Colombo, which we expect to arrive on Wednesday.

Once we receive the container back from you on the 10th, I’ll let you know. I’ll be in touch, and thank you for all your help thus far!

Sincerely,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for BTI Pulp Weight and Freight Adjustment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

I’m glad to hear from you again. We can offer you a lower rate for the 9th and 10th of this month. However, we cannot ship to you until at least the 18th of May, as we don’t yet know the exact volume of pulp you’ll be taking.

Sincerely,
Dr. Moreno

Thank you for your email. Please note that this charter is NOT with myself but with Matson Steamship Co, Inc (Matson Line). If you could kindly contact me regarding this charter matter, I will be able to assist.

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Crude Shipments

I specialize in material testing and characterization and am fluent in German. I have attached a copy of my CV for your reference. I am currently in the process of preparing my visa application, but I am confident that I can start working for you by October.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Flevin Ankerman

email_chain.subject: Landed Cost Information for Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Amit,

Could you provide the landed cost information for 4,000MT of sulfuric acid from Manzanillo to South Texas? Also, do you have any vessel options available?

Thanks,
Sally

email_chain.subject: RE: Landed Cost Information for Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

Apologies for the confusion earlier. I’m working on your quote for sulfuric acid now. Here’s the information you requested:

The vessel option you’re looking for is through Magenta, which will pick up the cargo from Manzanillo and deliver it to our Port of Entry in Corpus Christi. The vessel is scheduled to sail on January 15th, so please ensure your security letter for customs inspection is ready by then. Below are the vessel options:

1. **Magenta** - This is the cheapest option but has a longer transit time.
   - Transit Time: 37 days
   - Freight Cost: $5,990

2. **PCT** - This is the fastest option but comes at a higher cost.
   - Transit Time: 26 days
   - Freight Cost: $29,990

3. **PCT** - This option offers better value compared to Magenta.

Let me know if you need further details.

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: RE: Manzanillo to Corpus Christi – FOB Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Amit,

Thank you very much for this information. It’s extremely helpful. Unfortunately, my security letter wasn’t ready for the January 15th sail date, but we’re working on getting it approved for the next sail date.

Please let me know when you’re ready to confirm the sail date. I’ll follow up with the security letter once we have approval.

Thanks again!
Sally

email_chain.subject: RE: Manzanillo to Corpus Christi – FOB Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Amit,

Please confirm that we’re still on for the January 31st sail date. We received our security letter today, so we’re all set.

Thanks!
Sally

email_chain.subject: RE: Manzanillo to Corpus Christi – FOB Sulfuric Acid
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

I’m glad to hear that your security letter has been approved. I’ll get back to you with confirmation for the vessel once I have a clear update from Magenta regarding the January 31st sail date.

Also, please find attached a link to our latest newsletter, which I hope you’ll find useful.

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Update on Recent Operations
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Singh,

This will be a quick message to share an update on our operations. In October 2024, we moved over 1,000 tanks of LPG and 300MT of vegetable oil from Saudi Arabia to Vietnam. We will be shipping another 300 tanks of LPG and 200MT of vegetable oil in January 2025. We also just opened a new sales office in Tokyo.

If you have any questions about our recent shipments or about our new operations in Tokyo, feel free to reach out.

Thanks,
Nathan

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Singh,

This email will serve as formal confirmation of the above-mentioned shipment. 1,000 tanks of LPG and 300MT of vegetable oil from Saudi Arabia to Vietnam were successfully loaded into containers on schedule. Additional shipping to Vietnam in January 2025 will also proceed.

Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Jacob Smith

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Fraud Allegations
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to seek information regarding recent allegations of fraud against one of our clients. Last week, we received a complaint about a job applicant claiming to have been scammed out of $100,000 by our client. The individual claimed that our client had offered them a job as a software developer and asked them to wire $100,000 into an account for 'development work.' However, the applicant claims that the money was never received, and that our client never contacted them again.

Our client has denied the allegations and has provided proof of their location and business hours. We have also verified that our client did not have any contact with the applicant.

We understand that you may be concerned about this matter, and we apologize for any inconvenience it may have caused. We are committed to providing you with a safe and reliable service.

Best regards,
Info Team

email_chain.subject: Appreciation for the Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Singh,

We appreciate the update on our recent shipments. Our team is excited about the new opportunities that have opened up for us in Tokyo. Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Shipment

This email will serve as formal confirmation of the above-mentioned shipment. Please do not hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Eric Smith

email_chain.body:
Dear Janowski,

I hope this message finds you well. I am looking to arrange a fixture for shipping grain from Manzanillo to Salalah. I have 4,200MT available for this route. Do you have a vessel that can accommodate this cargo and return empty? Your assistance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Fixture Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Thank you for your email. I have a few details to clarify before I can proceed with posting this on your thread.

First, I want to clarify that the equipment in question is not my machine but an attached mobile crane. I will try to send you pictures shortly. It is a 40' truck crane, 2WD, equipped with a liquid pressure test kit in the front and a 'Smokin Box' on the side with a winch. It is fully self-contained with 40,000 gallons of diesel.

You can view pictures of the crane at this website: http://www.bradcoengineering.com. This is an Arizana 18m Truck Crane 2WD with a swivel winch in front that can hold up to 1000kg (2200lbs).

Best regards,
Janowski

Best regards,
Janowski

Additionally, could you provide information on whether your rates are competitive compared to other service providers? I revisited your website and remain very interested in your services. However, I have noticed that the charges for transporting a container from Hamburg to Yokohama have increased over the past two months. Given this, I am concerned that my budget may no longer cover the costs. Would it be possible for you to offer a discounted rate? I would also be willing to cover any additional expenses incurred due to my delayed response.

email_chain.subject: NBP Breakout and Crude Options Exposure
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

It looks like the NBP (NBP%) is breaking out to the upside. Is this a genuine bullish move? If so, we must increase our exposure to crude options from the low 40s to the 70s.

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Re: NBP Breakout and Crude Options Exposure
email_chain.body:
Great news!

I would love to take the credit for the move in crude. However, the change is an event-driven change. After releasing the Q4 2013 outlook call, crude oil finished off with a bang. The 42.5 handle just did not sustain the move.

Looking at the bigger picture, crude is confirming our trading zone of 40-46. There are still other factors affecting crude. There's more to say on that but I will save it for the next email.

Stay tuned!

Chichi

email_chain.subject: Re: NBP Breakout and Crude Options Exposure
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

With the 50 EMA just about to hit the 42.5 handle, will this be a good time to place the cut-loss order?

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Re: NBP Breakout and Crude Options Exposure
email_chain.body:
Chichi,

Without wasting too much time, here's the breakout scenario.

At 38.5 handle, crude was in a trading zone. Then, at 40, it closed above 38.5 handle (outside trading range). Next, we came in at 40.2 on the 7/23 call, triggering the highest swing up since 7/2 (42.5). And finally, at 42.5, we enter an overbought zone (up-trending market).

A stop is not necessary because our exit (42.5) is extremely protective. So, what happens next?

Chichi

email_chain.body:
Thank you for your enquiry for 200,000 MT of coal. We will try our best to secure a cargo for you. On a provisional basis, we would suggest you can do the cargo at $16/MT CFR (USD/MT). From your previous mail, it appears that your office will be handling all the ground operations of the shipment, so you would like to take the cargo. We can offer the same rates both in FOB and CFR for Newcastle to Vietnam/Bangladesh/Nepal region, but no further, as you would like to take the cargo at $16/MT (USD/MT) basis only. Our subject vessel is available at a free port and can be made available within 2 to 3 weeks. If you would like to proceed, we will need to finalize an agent at their end for coordination. We can also put you in contact with our agent for further assistance.

Regards,
Mr. Mitchell

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Refined Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

Could you advise your next open laycan for moving 5,200MT of refined aviation fuel from Houston to Amsterdam in late September? You may choose FOB or CIF. Do you accept lumpsum deals?

Kind regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Refined Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

Thank you for your message. We will be in Hamburg starting the second week of September, so we will be able to perform a CIF transfer there, provided you would also like to do the same.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Refined Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

The transfer goes fine. In fact, the customer overpaid.

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Refined Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

You are correct. The customer overpaid, but you are the one who must make the most out of this unexpected event. You have to convince the customer to take back some part of the overpaid amount. Remember that if you successfully make a profit, this is counted against the customer, as explained in our law agreement.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Refined Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

I thank you for your message. I already have a conversation with the customer, but I am waiting for his final response. The customer sent me a document, as you requested, which I forwarded to you. Do you have any comments about the additional documents?

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Refined Aviation Fuel Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

The documents look fine to me, but there are two things you have to do:
1. Find another mode of transport for the remaining 1,200 MT of aviation fuel, which the customer won't take back. You can make a lot of money with this volume, because this aviation fuel is due to be consumed on the day you will receive it in Amsterdam. The customer does not want to transport the 1,200 MT to Belgium, so the least you can do is to sell this additional aviation fuel on a spot basis and make sure that the credit risk of this contract is managed well.
2. Sell your FOB Hamburg cargo to the customer for a lump sum, to make sure that you receive all you deserve.

Remember to use the additional document we discussed in the previous message to cover all the risks.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Export of Car Batteries from Pakistan
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Our company exports 1/2 ton of car batteries (AA batteries) from Pakistan, typically 37 to 50 boxes (FCL) as a full load, also to the Middle East in containers.

We can provide these products to another party under your name for export by paying a 10% advance for inspection and service charges. Upon receipt of the 10% advance, we will send the full FCL to your shipping agent's office in the Middle East or the port of Singapore for shipping. We will bill you after your shipping agent clears the payment from the port of Singapore to our bank account in Pakistan.

Contact #: 001234567890

Please approve these terms and conditions, and we can ship immediately on any vessel from the Port of Karachi, Pakistan.

I hope you can arrange shipping to the port of Singapore from the Port of Karachi, Pakistan, on any vessel suitable for us.

Best regards,
Battery Exporter

I'm not sure if you have heard about this, but our vessel, Ibis, is heading towards your location. I just wanted to drop you a note to inform you that your goods will reach you on or before schedule. I will let you know if there's any need for me to make a move on your end. In the meantime, I will be working on your booking.

Vincent

Eric

Vincent

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vessel Availability for Pyridine Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dearest O’Donnell,

Could your vessel load 7,500MT of pyridine from Minoan in Zhoushan in early June? Would you confirm if your vessel can handle a mid-July laycan, and at what cost?

Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel Availability for Pyridine Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

Thanks for your early inquiry. Our client asks for a May 10, 2022 arrival in Tianjin, in 30 days' time. At the moment, it seems doable, as we have availability for 7,500MT pyridine. This could be via our 29,000 DWT Suezmax ship (slated for lifting) and chartering a 50,000 DWT VLCC, or by chartering a 50,000 DWT Suezmax (travelling round via the Suez Canal) or a 60,000 DWT VLCC. This would give you 6-7 weeks' notice for loading in Zhoushan. The total cost would be in the ballpark of US$8.5 million (about $0.10/bbl and $0.08/bbl for loading and charters). You would incur additional costs for demurrage and other fees.

Best regards,
O’Donnell

email_chain.subject: Schedule Inquiry for 6000dwt Unit
email_chain.body: Matthieu, could you check the schedule for a 6000dwt unit for the 4th week of February from Bremerhaven to Shanghai? Thanks a lot. Regards, Client

email_chain.subject: Schedule Confirmation for 6000dwt Unit
email_chain.body: Bonjour Client, after a phone call with shipowners, we have scheduled for your client the positioning to Bremerhaven on February 6th and departure on February 16th, 2016. The ship will be loading from Berth C at Bremerhaven. Port of call in 18 days will be Baogang on February 26th, Dayi on February 27th and Shanghai on February 28th. The expected load port will be Jinqiao on March 8th. Please find the itinerary attached. Best regards, Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Container Booking Dates and Conditions
email_chain.body: Bonjour Client, the dates for booking the containers are the following: LATEST END OF COMMERCIAL TRANSHIPMENT OF CONTAINERS: SGM delivery of a cargo to be loaded, in closed loop terminals or in door to door service. The cargo delivery must be provided at the latest on the SGM arrival date at the terminal, unless otherwise specified. LATEST START OF COMMERCIAL TRANSHIPMENT OF CONTAINERS: Request for changing existing bookings. SGM dispatching of a cargo loaded in the corresponding SGM terminal to be delivered to the consignee in a closed loop terminal or in door to door service, unless otherwise specified. From the next day following the last date mentioned above, the SGM will be entitled to keep the equipment blocked at the storage area. JINQIAO MAHUL TERMINAL: we don’t allow containers from Zone 2 being released in Terminal. The first set of containers can be released in 45 days from the end of the loading operation. For the remaining containers, it will take 50 days. The first set of containers released must be from the same storage area where they were first stored at the terminal. Best regards, Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Container Specifications and Restrictions
email_chain.body: Bonjour Client, there is no limitation of weight on the 40’ and 20’ containers. The containers must comply with the special conditions mentioned below: Containers must have a blockage no greater than 2.5cm (measurement measured from the center line) to load and to unload the cargo. If the blockage is greater than 2.5cm (measurements taken from the center line), it will be the responsibility of the carrier to accept the equipment. Exposed wooden blocks, wooden blocks in contact with tarpaulins, or exposed boards of wood boards, do not conform to our standards. One Vortex vent per 20’ container, for each row of pallets, shall be installed. This is particularly important in case of accidents (e.g. explosion, fire) to avoid containers from flooding. The presentation and the placement of the containers must be followed precisely. No chemical loading. Exceptions will be only done by the Shipping Company’s representative and on the condition of having the application form filled in the Tank Cleaning department with a valid authorization from the Ship’s Master. RORO: no crossing by ramp allowed between two terminals. Hazardous substances are not permitted in Jinqiao. Containers from China and less than 20’ can be offloaded directly in the shed, on the floor, upon loading on trailers. Containers from Europe can be offloaded in the terminal. Best regards, Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Customer Value Retention Rate (CVR)
email_chain.body:
Hello David,

I have two customers who have repeatedly purchased from me—one for 1,000 orders and the other for 2,000 orders. Are they using my online tool, or are they purchasing over the phone, or both?

There’s no clear answer, but here are a few pointers to help you understand:

Remember that the CVR (Customer Value Retention Rate) is the percentage of customers that return for repeat orders. You can calculate this by looking at the percentage of orders that came back to you (or didn’t).

For example, if you sold 200 widgets to company A, and 50% of those widgets were purchased again the next time A purchased from you, your CVR is 50%. These measurements can help predict how well your company retains customers.

Best regards,
Yinan

email_chain.subject: Re: Customer Value Retention Rate (CVR)
email_chain.body:
Hello Yinan,

I have one customer who purchased from me 2,000 times over 20 years. Is he using my online tool? What about the others?

You can’t assume everyone uses the same tools. Here’s a reasonable assumption:

1. If a customer made 2,000 purchases over 20 years, you can assume they used your tools for at least 20 years.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.body:
James,

Your agent tells me that he could not book my grain until the 5th, so I will wait for that. I also sent the container in Rotterdam by ZIM/Ironman/1RIT04Z3072/3. I will email again in the morning.

Anna

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Grain Shipment
email_chain.body:
Anna,

ZIM has three options for empty return from Halifax to Rotterdam:
1. COD Rotterdam, tomorrow Thursday 31st.
2. One container from Hamburg to Rotterdam, Friday 1st February 2013.
3. The shipment is guaranteed by ZIM, and the container will be in Rotterdam on the 2nd. ZIM would like the container at their terminal on Thursday before 4 pm.

A fourth option is sending my container by MSC to Bremerhaven and then the empty return on COD Rotterdam on Thursday, because ZIM cannot get me a guaranteed return in time. You have the choice.

James

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Grain Shipment
email_chain.body:
Anna,

I just sent you my booking for your grain from Rotterdam to Halifax. I will check if we can book your empty return from Halifax to Rotterdam by MSC/COD. If that is possible, I will let you know asap. Your load would be shipped with ZIM/Rotterdam/Y245877 (added date). Let me know if you have any questions.

James

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Grain Shipment
email_chain.body:
Anna,

I asked ZIM, and it is possible to book your empty return from Halifax to Rotterdam by MSC/COD Rotterdam on the 31st. Your empty container would be taken from the ZIM terminal in Halifax on the 31st, but I will need the following information:
- Container no:
- Make, model, and weight of the engine.
- Serial number:
- If it is possible to put the engine on deck in Rotterdam.

We do not need the engine.

James

email_chain.subject: Request for Preliminary Quote - Heavy Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Max,

We’ve got 13,500MT of heavy gasoline in Cartagena that we’d like to ship out asap. Could you provide a preliminary quote and confirm if you handle port dues under FOB terms?

Best regards,
Dan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Preliminary Quote - Heavy Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

With regard to your message above, I’m happy to start a conversation about your logistics needs. It seems there are some potential risks, including weather impact and Suez Canal bottlenecks that will affect transportation. As such, the earliest available vessel for loading the cargo is not for another 14 days. However, you can still ship this cargo by the fastest available vessel for an additional premium of 7% if you are prepared to pay for the cost difference and the fees associated with carrying the risk of uncertainty. The sea freight cost is typically cheaper because the additional cost will only be incurred in the unlikely event of an inevitable delay or cancellation.

I am attaching some indicative transport cost estimates for your review. These calculations are based on the available information, including port dues, and thus these figures may be subject to change depending on the final contract details.

Kind regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Preliminary Quote - Heavy Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

Thank you for your prompt response. I will confirm the exact volumes by the end of today. Our usual weekly schedule is the 27th January.

In the meantime, this cargo is classified as an LPG product and is subject to a 2% surcharge due to the very high shipping cost.

If you’re ready, I will send the final quote to you today.

Thanks,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Preliminary Quote - Heavy Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dan,

Thank you for confirming the exact volumes. We have already confirmed the vessel and have sent you the quote details. Kindly confirm if you are ready to sign.

In addition, we’ve requested that the vessel add another 1,000 tons to its cargo capacity as we are expecting another customer to require additional 1,000 MT in addition to the one we have already on board. We have reviewed your contracts.

Best regards,
Max

email_chain.subject: Request to Charter MV
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Palazzani,

We are back with our request to charter your MV. Please find attached the charter parties and the rates for your vessel. Our rates are fixed. Kindly give us a final reply.

Regards,
Phoebe

email_chain.subject: Re: Request to Charter MV
email_chain.body:
Dear Phoebe,

Thank you for your inquiry and interest in our vessels. We are very pleased to receive the charter party you have sent us. We have reviewed it carefully and would like to make the following suggestions:

1) The charter parties will be generated automatically by us and will be sent to you in PDF format. The terms of the charter are defined within the charter. The charter company is free to change the terms, such as rate, charter period, safety issues, etc. These terms can be customized at any time before the charter is signed.

2) Please note that our terms and conditions are outlined on our website (http://www.onlinedonecharter.net/), as per your consent, and are also available in PDF format. These terms should be read and agreed to by our crew before they are eligible to serve on our vessel. We recommend you to add these terms.

Best regards,
Mr. Palazzani

email_chain.subject: Re: Request to Charter MV
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Palazzani,

We have reviewed your charter party and have made the necessary amendments as you suggested. Kindly send us the hard copy of the charter party and our proposed amendment. Please find attached our amendment.

Regards,
Phoebe

email_chain.subject: Re: Request to Charter MV
email_chain.body:
Dear Phoebe,

Please note that you have to forward us the legal documents of all the crew members before their onboarding. The legal documents should include a valid passport, relevant certificate of completion, valid ship security clearance, medical certificate (Med5), etc. Please let us know if you have any questions about this.

Best regards,
Mr. Palazzani

email_chain.subject: Request for NAAF Cargo Delivery from Daesan to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,

We require 900MT of non-Alcohol and Fuel Cargo (NAAF) from Daesan to Osaka, and are considering calling on your vessel on the following dates:
- Wednesday, May 23rd. Any chances of delivering by Friday, May 25th?
- Thursday, May 24th. Any chances of delivery by Saturday, May 26th?

Would you please confirm delivery by any of these dates?

Many thanks,
Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for NAAF Cargo Delivery from Daesan to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Dear Chen,

I apologize for the delay in my response. However, I need some more information to confirm our schedule. Specifically, I need to know which product to ship to Osaka on which day, i.e., Tuesday, May 29th or Wednesday, May 30th. Since we are unable to offer a rate for an incomplete request, I have not replied earlier. We need a day-by-day schedule of the products being shipped to Osaka. Once we have this information, we will be able to provide you with an accurate rate and transit time. For instance, if the products are the same every day, then you can provide us with the total amount of products and the total transit time is two days.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for NAAF Cargo Delivery from Daesan to Osaka
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,

First, I apologize for the confusion. The shipper will contact you to provide the actual details of the cargo. I will attach our cargo information, and please confirm the arrival date of each cargo, or we'll be calling on Daesan with 3 to 5 trailers of the same cargo.

Thanks,
Chen

- Attachments: cargo_info.pdf

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Bitumen Shipment from Jubail to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Victor,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am Matthieu, the logistics expert at Al Mada Shipping Company. We are happy to assist you with your shipment.

Please find the details below:
- The shipment is scheduled for October this year.
- One 20ft standard container will be used for the shipment.
- The container will be dry cargo.
- This is a 20' GP container, no lashings required.

We will assist you with the necessary paperwork, including the bill of lading, loading list, and certificate of origin. We will keep you updated on the status of your shipment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Bitumen Shipment from Jubail to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

Thank you for your email and for considering our services. We understand you require assistance with transporting a shipment of bitumen from Jubail, Saudi Arabia, to Salalah, Oman. Unfortunately, after reviewing your request, we regret to inform you that we are unable to offer our services for the following reasons:
1. Our company specializes in shipping perishables and LCL cargo (groups of containers), and we do not handle full containers.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and wish you the best in finding a suitable partner for your shipment.

Best regards,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Documentation for Funchal Client
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Luis,

It has been brought to my attention that you will be handling the documentation for our client at Funchal next month. However, we cannot guarantee 50% of the documentation requirements, such as notices of loads and demurrage. We will not hold ourselves accountable for any further costs incurred.

If you would like to discuss this further, please contact me.

Best wishes,
Margarita Madison

email_chain.subject: Re: Documentation for Funchal Client
email_chain.body:
Dear Margarita,

I am sorry to hear that the documentation will not be ready. This could lead to major headaches on the day of sailing. It would also put extra pressure on our client, and I cannot have that.

I believe that you must issue all of the documentation to be presented. I have explained to you that this is the only way that I can ensure the safety of my client's interests.

I need your confirmation by Wednesday at the latest that the documentation will be issued to the best of your ability.

If I do not hear from you by the end of the day on Wednesday, I will issue my client's letter of indemnity.

Kind regards,
Luis Perez

email_chain.subject: Concerns Regarding Cruise Itinerary
email_chain.body:
Dear Margarita,

I am contacting you to discuss the concerns I have regarding the issues on the cruise.

Despite the itinerary on the website stating that a 5-hour lunch break would be given in the daytime, this was not the case. Our client's cruise began early in the morning, and at the start of the first afternoon, the cruise stopped for an hour, where the client's lunch would have been normally taken.

Following this, our client informed the cruise company that she would not be able to attend any additional activities during the second part of the cruise, due to her trip abroad the next morning.

Unfortunately, after the cruise stopped, the client left to change her outfit for dinner. It is clear to me that her actions were not entirely justified. However, what can I do as the representative of our client?

I feel that the cruise company must compensate the client for the disappointment of the experience.

Kind regards,
Luis Perez

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Charges for Soybean 2607 and Automobile Gas Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Turner,

I received your email regarding the soybean 2607 shipment from Singapore to Hampton Roads, Virginia, and I see a demurrage charge of $13,500. However, I want to pay for the 4th order, which is 3,000MT of automobile gas from Singapore to Kandla, with 45 days laytime, and I will pay a demurrage charge of $3,500. I think the difference in charges should be lower. Please let me know what you think.

Thank you very much,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charges for Soybean 2607 and Automobile Gas Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

Thank you for your reply. However, our terminal demurrage is not the same. Please read carefully below so that I may have a better idea of what the demurrage would be for a small order.

'The business terminal of Port of Newark charges a minimum terminal demurrage on each vessel on a per day per TEU basis at the rate of $5.00 per day, per TEU. In addition, terminal demurrage is also calculated based on the days the vessel remains alongside and/or in any accessible waters, and by the number of TEUs still berthed on the vessel.'

In my situation, is it based on the amount of time the ship remains in Singapore, 1 day, 2 days, or the amount of weight (in MT) I will pay demurrage for?

I hope you can clarify.

Best regards,
Mr. Turner

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charges for Soybean 2607 and Automobile Gas Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Turner,

Thank you for your response. I have a few questions:

1. Is there a minimum time frame the ship will need to stay in Singapore, then the demurrage charge will be calculated based on that amount of time?
2. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 3,000MT?
3. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 6,000MT?
4. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 15,000MT?
5. How much would the demurrage be based on if I ship automobile gas at a weight of 24,000MT?
6. Does the amount of time need to be adjusted based on the weight of the shipment?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charges for Soybean 2607 and Automobile Gas Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Turner,

I received your email. As I mentioned in my last email, can you please tell me what is the time it takes to clear the ship in Singapore based on the weight of my order? Is it 5 days, 7 days, 10 days, or 15 days?

Thank you,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Charges for Soybean 2607 and Automobile Gas Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

Thanks for your detailed explanation. I received a very similar email earlier this morning, but the case was very straightforward as the seller had advised that the vessel was to be cleared on the 21st of August, and demurrage would commence from the 22nd. I was able to quickly email back the response based on your case for a 45-day laytime to commence on the 22nd.

However, with regards to your case where you are buying a small quantity (3,000MT), I do not believe the seller should be paying the terminal demurrage as this is considered a short-term booking and is covered under the charterer's guarantee as per the charter party. The charterer will want to ensure that the ship is not stuck in port for any longer than necessary for whatever reason and therefore, will want to arrange for the vessel to be cleared as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Mr. Turner

email_chain.subject: Cricket Equipment Transit Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Andrea,

I’m currently on a journey from Brisbane to Quetta with a container full of cricket equipment. Could you please advise if the cricket equipment requires any special handling during transit?

Regards,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Cricket Equipment Transit Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

Good to hear from you. I’ve just received my visa and am ready to pick up my shipment and make arrangements to travel. I’ve shipped a container of cricket equipment from Brisbane and need to know if you can assist with picking it up from the port. Additionally, I’ll need your help with customs clearance. Should I hire a local customs agent, or can you handle it? Also, how do I contact the shipping agent?

Regards,
Andrea

email_chain.subject: Re: Cricket Equipment Transit Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hey Andrea,

I’ve taken your advice and hired a local customs agent to clear the cricket equipment. I’ve also arranged to pick up the container from the port. The agent mentioned that the equipment must be cleared within a few days to avoid the container being sold. He also emphasized the importance of using a local customs agent for this process. I’ll be flying to Quetta in 10 days and will arrive at the port to collect the container. The agent has arranged for a truck to transport the container to my address. I have a few questions:

1. How do you pay for the clearance?
2. Will the trucking company charge us a fee?
3. What if the container is full? I need to send all my cricket equipment, but I’m unsure if everything will fit.

Regards,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Cricket Equipment Transit Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

1. How do you pay for the clearance?
If you’re paying for clearance and the agent is handling it, I recommend using a pre-paid card and keeping the receipt. Once you’re in Quetta, the agent will pay the fees and retain the receipt for their records. When you collect your cricket equipment, you’ll reimburse the agent and keep their receipt.

2. Will the trucking company charge us a fee?
3. What if the container is full? I need to send all my cricket equipment, but I’m unsure if everything will fit.

Regarding fees, ask the agent to provide a quote. Once you confirm the cost, pay the agent, and they should file the paperwork. I suggest requesting a copy of the quote for your records.

Regards,
Andrea

Best regards,
Sender1

email_chain.subject: Request for Sellers and Dispatch Procedure
email_chain.body:
Hello James,

Could you send some sellers to my office next week for a price inquiry? Also, what kind of procedure do you have when dispatching cotton from Port Sudan to Qingdao?

Best,
Isabelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Sellers and Dispatch Procedure
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your inquiry. You may contact Mr. Adebayouba Ayodeji in your office or call us directly in Lagos at +234-803-571-0994.

Mutebi Group Plc
[Est. 1986]

We are renowned as a marketing company for local rice and cotton. In 2011, we decided to begin cotton marketing, particularly for our reputable local spinning mill clients. To this end, we have been actively developing a network of registered cotton farmers, with the ultimate goal of providing and marketing cotton to our spinning mill clients as well as other cotton users locally and internationally. Our company is currently working with cotton farmers in Benue, Kano, Jigawa, and other Northern States to establish and manage quality agricultural activities (farming and ginning) in a business-like manner.

email_chain.subject: Follow-up Questions
email_chain.body:
I am trying to contact the email address of Mr. Ayodeji. Can you please help me out with this?

Additionally, I have a few questions:
1. Is there an after-sales service on the farm when the cotton is harvested?
2. How much is the average acreage of 1 hectare?
3. Are you affiliated with any cotton gin? If so, how can we get into a business relationship?
4. Are you currently supplying cotton to spinning mills in Nigeria?
5. If yes, have you already gotten enough buyers for the 2015/2016 season?
6. How do you set up the prices for each cotton type on the platform?
7. How do you sell and get your profits?

Best,
Isabelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up Questions
email_chain.body:
This is Michael Adebayo, working with Mr. Ayodeji Adebayouba. Mr. Ayodeji is the Regional General Manager. I can be reached at the following email address: michael@outlook.com, or by phone at +2348054092947.

Best regards,
Michael Adebayo

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up Questions
email_chain.body:
We thank you for contacting us and for your interest in investing in our cotton farming operation.

This is to inform you that we have been growing cotton in partnership with registered and experienced cotton farmers in Benue State. We offer long-term partnership opportunities to investors or customers of our cotton product. With this partnership, your company will have access to our farming base and cotton production statistics.

With the current average cotton yield of about 900 kgs/acre, we expect to achieve a yield of 1,800 kgs/acre in the near future.

Best regards,
Mutebi Group Plc

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Aluminum Shipment from Mombasa to Haiphong
email_chain.body:
Hi Koen,

I have a 6,500MT shipment of aluminum from Mombasa to Haiphong. Is it still feasible for us to ship by 19 July? We’re worried about tariff risk due to COP26, so please let us know your best offer.

Many thanks,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Aluminum Shipment from Mombasa to Haiphong
email_chain.body:
Hi Koen,

I hope you’re well. I’ve read through the COP26 tax proposal with interest. As you are aware, the EDC tax rate will increase to 6% in 2023, which means it could reach $70 / mt if the rate doesn’t rise again in the following years. Therefore, it’s important for us to ship this order before COP26 takes effect, as we’re planning on increasing our exposure to aluminum.

I have a few questions:
1. The current EDC tax rate is 3%, and there’s an additional 3% tax in 2023 and 4% in 2024. Is there any clarity on what the rate will be in the following years? I know this may change, but it’s difficult to predict.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Aluminum Shipment from Mombasa to Haiphong
email_chain.body:
Hi Koen,

We also have a product which is looking to ship in November. Do you think it is worth considering a new LCOE contract on top of the cost for us? There’s a good probability of seeing it drop because of the weakening Dalian index. But don’t expect the same discount as in previous deals. It’s quite difficult to find lumps in the market. LCOEs are hard to find.

I've sent the documentation in the email. Please let me know if there are any issues. I also attached the FMC Declaration to see if that's something you need. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions.

Thank you for your help!

Best regards,
Adrian

Adrian

Please let me know how this affects our shipment and if we need to make alternative arrangements.

Best regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Cargo Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Benjamin,

We need to know your future availability to avoid cargo delays. We plan to send a cargo of lime three times in a row, followed by a cargo of vegetable oil two weeks later. You have a dry cargo vessel available for the lime, but it will only be available for the vegetable oil after a two-week laytime. Do you have any vessels that can handle the lime cargo? Please let us know now and confirm again the day before the date you are available for the vegetable oil.

We would appreciate it if you could advise us on your current availability.

Thank you,
Luis

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Luis,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our availability is as follows:

- The vessel 'KT BV' is available for loading lime starting from 12/27/13. We can handle another load of lime on 1/2/14 and a load of vegetable oil on 1/15/14.
- The vessel 'RHV BV' is also available for lime cargo starting from 12/27/13 and can handle a load of vegetable oil on 12/29/13.

Please let us know if this works for you.

Sincerely,
Nina

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Nina,

Thank you for your offer. We accept the load of lime from 12/27/13 on your vessel 'KT BV'. Please confirm the availability for the vegetable oil load on 1/15/14.

Best regards,
Luis

email_chain.subject: Cargo Loading Update
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Benjamin,

I have just contacted the transporter who will be loading your vessel 'KT BV'. They plan to load the vessel this morning. While I do not have a complete bill of lading yet, we can proceed with a load confirmation if you wish. However, we will need a copy of the bill of lading and a signed cargo receipt. Could you please advise when you will receive your papers?

Thank you,
Luis

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Loading Update
email_chain.body:
Hi Luis,

We are pleased to confirm that we will receive the cargo receipt from your shipper by tomorrow (12/31/13). Additionally, our master will receive the bill of lading. He will be available at our pier tomorrow (12/31/13), though I do not know the exact time of his arrival.

Sincerely,
Nina

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Loading Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Luis,

I have sent you an email regarding your cargo. I now have a copy of the signed cargo receipt. Our master will arrive at the pier on 1/1/14 around 10 a.m. If the bill of lading arrives before that time, we can send you a copy.

Could you please confirm if this arrangement works for you?

Sincerely,
Nina

email_chain.subject: Request for Demurrage Rate and Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

We’re looking at 4,100MT of anthracite coal from West Bengal to Kuching. Could you please confirm your demurrage rate and the weekend berth restrictions? Additionally, would you anticipate providing a lumpsum freight quote?

Regards,
Jade

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Demurrage Rate and Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Good morning Jade,

Thank you for your email. The demurrage charges for your requirement would be USD 10 per day, subject to the ICD storage fee. We will require a two-week clearance period. We can provide you with a lump sum quote for this requirement upon receipt of the details, including your FCO, B/L details, and DCS information.

Your samples for coal testing can be shipped along with the main consignment, or you can instruct us to receive the sample at the ICD and arrange for pickup from there. Please note that we are unable to open your samples at the ICD itself; this can only be done at the port facility where your shipment is due to be loaded onto the vessel.

Your vessel would have a berth from 26 July to 3 August. Therefore, we will be able to load your shipment between these dates.

Best regards,
Broker

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Demurrage Rate and Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your prompt response.

Could you please provide the additional information? Are you able to process the cargo under my terms & conditions? Also, could you send the terms & conditions via email? Lastly, how can I send you the completed quotation?

Regards,
Jade

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Demurrage Rate and Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Thanks Jade for your prompt response,

It’s my pleasure to provide you with the requested information:

The sample testing will be done at the port facility where the cargo is due to be loaded. We will need to have a sample FCO for each item we are receiving. When the cargo is tested, we will only have the test report for each item, and we will be unable to know the quantity of each item separately. The invoice for the samples will be generated as a separate invoice from the main cargo invoice.

Would you please confirm whether you can accept our standard terms and conditions?

Best regards,
Broker

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Dispatch for Steel Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Phal,

For the shipping of steel from Port Kelang to Khor Al Zabbar, we are facing an issue with lightering at the port and need to discharge within 3 hours. Could you please find the fastest and most reliable vessel to dispatch the cargo from Port Kelang to Khor Al Zabbar?

Kindly,
Prince

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Dispatch for Steel Shipping
email_chain.body:
I assume you are referring to the STS discharge of cargo off of the BULKER Berth 7 in Port Kelang, Malaysia.

The most reliable vessel would be the bulker ZEMASHTO. The following link is the ZEMASHTO schedule, do check to see if she has any port calls planned: http://www.fleeter.com/Schedu...CafCoMarine-DwhThomo.txt.

You may contact Mr. E. Sary, the agent in Port Kelang, by sending him an email to Sary@KelangMarineSDNBHD.com.

Sincerely,
Quan Chu

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Dispatch for Steel Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Quan Chu,

Thank you for your email. I have discussed this case with Sary, our representative at Port Kelang. Sary says that the ZEMASHTO, one of our ships, is now on the berth and has 8 hours to offload. Therefore, I believe this vessel is the most reliable for the cargo discharge from the BULKER Berth 7 in Port Kelang, Malaysia.

Should there be any other issue or inquiry, please feel free to contact me.

Regards,
Prince

email_chain.subject: Queries Regarding Port of Tema
email_chain.body:
Sirs,

We have the following queries in connection with the port of Tema:

1) Could you kindly confirm if there is a fourth berth at Tema?
2) If there is a fourth berth, could you please provide the length and depth of the berth?

5) Can I expect the pilot to come aboard in the morning?
6) Could you please provide the name and contact information of the pilotage station?
7) Could you please provide the contact information of the tug company?
8) Could you please provide the name and contact information of the customs?
9) Could you please provide the name

Kindly,
Prince

email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello M/s Alex,

I need to schedule a shipment of 3,200MT of diesel from Venezuela to Rotterdam. I have 8 deliveries planned from July 15 to Aug 1. How much is your deposit? Do you prefer payment by wire transfer or cash?

Looking forward to your reply,

Tal

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Tal,

Thank you for the inquiry. We will be glad to proceed with your request. Our minimum deposit amount is US$100,000 per shipment. Since you are requesting 8 shipments, the total minimum deposit would be US$800,000, to be paid in 8 instalments of US$100,000 each. This amount will be deducted from the total value of your shipments. For instance, if you are shipping 3,200MT of diesel at US$500 per MT, the total cost would be US$1,600,000. After deducting the deposit, the remaining cost would be US$800,000.

This advance payment is required to guarantee your shipment and ensure payment of freight charges. It serves as a surety for our services. Please let us know your preferred payment method.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Tal,

I apologize for any confusion earlier. Please note that the higher deposit requirement is due to the large volume of your shipment and the short notice. Our forwarders are risk-averse and must allocate significant resources to freight. This deposit ensures that we can proceed with your shipment without financial risk.

I hope this clarifies our position. Please let us know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Alex
