email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Liquid Sugar Transport to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Hi Katie,

We’d like to move 6,000MT of liquid sugar to Surabaya using a 27,000MT Heavy lift/Project cargo Carrier. Do you have availability for loading by the 20th of June? Additionally, could you provide details on your earliest demurrage structure?

Thank you for your time.

Best regards,
Brian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Liquid Sugar Transport to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Dear Brian,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, we do not have any availability for cargo loading by the 20th of June. Our vessels have a Bunker Bill due, which is expected to be settled by the 13th of June. The earliest we would be available for loading would be on the 25th of June.

Regarding demurrage, our rates start from USD 1.00 per cubic foot per day, with a maximum annual rate of USD 75 per cubic foot. The terms are as follows:

Shipowner's Demurrage Policy:
A) FOB Conditions: Shipowner's Demurrage Rates: USD 1.00 per cubic foot per day, subject to a maximum annual rate of USD 75 per cubic foot.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Katie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Liquid Sugar Transport to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Dear Brian,

After a quick review of our schedule, I regret to inform you that there are no available slots until August. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Thanks and best regards,
Katie

labels.demurrage: 1.00 per cubic foot per day, max 75 per cubic foot annually

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Capacity and Bunker Escalation Clause
email_chain.body:
Can your vessel lift 8,400 MT of clinker from Sohar to Mombasa? Also, do you apply a bunker escalation clause or keep a fixed rate?

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Capacity and Bunker Escalation Clause
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for your inquiry. Due to the complexity of bulk rates, both simple and indexed escalation clauses are commonly used in the sea cargo market. Bulk rates are based on bunker price and tonnage. Escalation clauses are used to implement the benefits of a bunker cost increase and prevent the carrier from changing the contract rate and extending it through an escalation clause. Generally, escalation clauses are used when a contract purchaser is concerned about the impact of a bunker price increase. Should the bunker price increase, bulk rates and contracts are usually adjusted accordingly. A bunker escalation clause allows the parties to index their contracts on a timely basis rather than having to wait until a contract is being renewed or terminated. In addition, an escalation clause in a contract increases the incentive for the parties to achieve cost savings by allowing the buyer to negotiate an adjustment when the seller is benefiting from a rise in the cost.

Best regards,
Shipping Team

Alex

email_chain.subject: Enquiry for Naphtha Cargo from Singapore to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Kape,

We’re organizing a 3,500MT cargo of Naphtha from Singapore to Fujairah. What’s your usual demurrage structure?

Cheers,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Naphtha Cargo from Singapore to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the request, George. I’m willing to offer you a 3 days DEM for the cargo based on our current NORM. The schedule is as follows:

Regards,
Kape Gas

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Naphtha Cargo from Singapore to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

Thanks for your enquiry. We are honoured to serve your company. However, we require at least 10 tonnes of your cargo in order to cover our transport cost.

Our rate is $3.50 per tonne per day. Your first payment of $35.00 shall be due once you receive the cargo. We would like your usual terms of payment for freight to be as per email from last week.

Regards,
Kape Gas

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Naphtha Cargo from Singapore to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Kape,

The cargo is as follows:

We would like to contract your services for the cargo. Kindly email back your quote and terms and conditions.

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Naphtha Cargo from Singapore to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Below is our quote and terms and conditions. Kindly confirm the contract with us and let us know if you have any questions. We look forward to working together with you.

Regards,
Kape Gas

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote - 6000 MT of Corn
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I’d like to send 6000 MT of corn through the port of Savannah to Philadelphia. The ship is loading from January 15th to January 20th. I need your offer on ex-shipboard FOB vessel terms.

Thank you,
Ms. Meggie

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - 6000 MT of Corn
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Meggie,

Thanks for submitting your request for import and export shipments. I will review your request and contact you shortly.

Thanks,
Edith

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote - 400,000 Pounds of Corn
email_chain.body:
Dear Edith,

I am the Chairman of the North Georgia Grocery. I have over 300,000 pounds of corn in my storage. I'd like to send 400,000 pounds from Savannah, GA to Philadelphia, PA. We would like to receive a quote with FOB Savannah shipment terms. We need the corn to arrive in Philadelphia by December 2015.

Please email me the best price you can offer, and also include your terms in your response.

Thank you,
Mr. Mike North

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote - 300,000 Pounds of Wheat and 400,000 Pounds of Corn
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I'm the owner of XYZ Corporation in Norfolk, VA. I need to buy 300,000 pounds of wheat and 400,000 pounds of corn. Please send me a quote on your offer with FOB vessel terms.

Thank you,
Mr. Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - 300,000 Pounds of Wheat and 400,000 Pounds of Corn
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Fred,

Thank you for contacting our firm. I have reviewed your email, and you have requested us to provide a quote for 300,000 pounds of wheat and 400,000 pounds of corn for shipment to Philadelphia. I will send you a price offer via email, along with our terms and conditions.

Please confirm if this is what you need.

Thank you,
Ms. Edith

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Anna,

I have just closed a deal for 5,000MT of corn oil to be shipped from Dhahran to Naples. Could you provide an offer for this shipment? Additionally, I would like to know if there is a freight payment system that might suit my client’s needs.

Kind Regards,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Terry,

Thank you for reaching out. I can certainly prepare an offer for the 5,000MT corn oil shipment from Dhahran to Naples. I will also provide details on the freight payment system options that could suit your client’s requirements.

Thank you for informing us about your new client. We appreciate the opportunity to assist.

Best regards,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Logistics for Mr. Russell's Order
email_chain.body:
Hi Charlotte,

I’m on the receiving end of Mr. Russell’s email, and wanted to let you know our logistics department will be able to handle this order. What are we looking at for logistics costs, and are they going to be in addition to our land transport rate?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Logistics for Mr. Russell's Order
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

Mr. Russell recently sent me an email confirming his wishes for the new pallets. He asked if they would be ready in time for delivery in 3 weeks. I thought you might like to see his email. It looks like he’s looking for more product than I first thought.

So, to summarize:
- Mr. Russell ordered 20 new pallets for 20,000 units.
- Delivery is scheduled in 3 weeks.
- We can handle this with the current pallets, but it will be tight. (Let’s talk logistics.)

You mentioned it would be good to speak with Mr. Russell about the shipping costs, but we’re on the hook for a $2,000 deposit. We can run the numbers and let you know how much you’re looking at for shipping costs.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
Tami

email_chain.subject: Re: Logistics for Mr. Russell's Order
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

Tami’s response has gone into a queue waiting for our Logistics Manager to respond. Do you want me to check back in 10 minutes to see what his response has been?

I can tell you that Mr. Russell wants you to confirm delivery for next Tuesday. The first pallet should be ready for delivery on Friday.

Thanks,
Charlotte

email_chain.subject: Re: Logistics for Mr. Russell's Order
email_chain.body:
Hi Charlotte,

Tami is about to call us and confirm delivery. Thanks for the reminder.

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Request for Flour Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mrs. Ocampo,

Can you get me your best offer for 2,000MT of flour from Japan to Rotterdam this Saturday? Please quote CIF.

Thanks,
Etienne

email_chain.subject: Flour Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Etienne,

We are the largest producer of flour in the world and export 100,000 tons of flour each year. We are interested in your offer. Our offer is EUR 1,000 per ton CIF.

Please get back to me.

Sincerely,
Harriet

email_chain.subject: Re: Flour Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Harriet,

Thanks for your offer. Our offer is EUR 1,500 per ton CIF, so please let us know if you are interested.

Best,
Etienne

email_chain.subject: Re: Flour Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Etienne,

We are the largest producer of flour in the world and export 100,000 tons of flour each year. We are interested in your offer.

Sincerely,
Harriet

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Rate
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

We have 6,200MT of wine to ship from Sydney to Shanghai. We'd like your rate for a mid-December cargo. What should your best price be?

Thanks,
Rod

email_chain.subject: Customer Feedback
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Here's what our customers have told us they like about working with you:

'When there are no shipments out for 5-10 days, the office is always run by Peter. Peter is a most trusted and professional businessman. You are a real friend of ours.'

Thanks a lot,
Sincerely,
Rod

email_chain.subject: Invoice for Payment
email_chain.body:
Hello Peter,

Please use the attached invoice for your payment.

Thanks and regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Service Feedback
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Great service. Everything is fine.

Thanks again.
Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

This is to confirm the shipment No. HVM-COR200X-00449, which has already arrived at our bonded warehouse in Melbourne. Our arrangement is that the 'dry' container with wine can be released once we receive the PHS certificate and customs release from your side.

email_chain.subject: Shipment Arrival
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Arrived here in Melbourne.

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote - Glycerine from Hamburg to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear DTC,

We plan to ship 8,500MT of glycerine from Hamburg to Qingdao. Could you please advise the load density, lumpsum rate, and if you have a vessel suited for this cargo type?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Sebastian

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Glycerine from Hamburg to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Sebastian,

Thank you for your inquiry. We are pleased to inform you that we can accommodate your shipment. The cargo is scheduled to sail in December 2015. Please confirm the forwarder number so we can proceed with the booking.

Best regards,
DTC

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Glycerine from Hamburg to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Sebastian,

As per your request, the details are mentioned below. Please contact our forwarder or reach out to us directly for further assistance.

Best regards,
DTC

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Glycerine from Hamburg to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Sebastian,

We will not be sending a formal quotation as our DTC (Direct to Customer) rates are now lower than some of our regular global agents. We would appreciate it if you could provide the forwarder details, if you have one in mind. Additionally, please confirm the sailing date for the vessel loaded with glycerine, as we would like to book this in advance to avoid any issues later on.

Best regards,
DTC

email_chain.subject: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, I hope this message finds you well. We are looking to arrange a shipment of bulk commodities and would like to inquire about your availability and rates. Could you please provide us with a quote? Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, Thank you for your inquiry. Could you please provide more details about the cargo, including type, volume, and any specific requirements? Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, The cargo is bulk grain, approximately 50,000 metric tons. We are looking for a vessel that can load from Port A and discharge at Port B. Please let us know your availability and rates. Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, Thank you for the details. We have a vessel available that can accommodate your requirements. The freight rate would be $25 per metric ton. Please confirm if this works for you. Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, The rate seems acceptable. Could you please provide the vessel details and the estimated laytime? Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, The vessel is MV Oceanic, with a DWT of 60,000 and LOA of 200 meters. The estimated laytime is from 2023-10-15 to 2023-10-20. Please confirm your acceptance. Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, We accept the terms. Please proceed with the booking. Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, Booking confirmed. We will send you the contract shortly. Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Inquiry for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, Thank you. We look forward to receiving the contract. Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Contract for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, Please find attached the contract for the cargo shipment. Kindly review and sign at your earliest convenience. Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, I have reviewed and signed the contract. Please find the signed copy attached. Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, Thank you for the signed contract. We will proceed with the arrangements. Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, Thank you. Please keep us updated on the progress. Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body: Dear John, Will do. We will provide updates as the shipment progresses. Best regards, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Offer for 20,000MT Ore Shipment from Chile to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Martinez,

We understand you have a cargo of approximately 20,000MT of ores for shipment from Chile to Antwerp. Our offer is $70 per ton net. Could you please provide the cargo terms and voyage details?

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for 20,000MT Ore Shipment from Chile to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Martinez,

I would like to confirm our offer of $70 per ton for the shipment from Chile to Antwerp. The cargo terms are FCA for loading and port-to-port for transportation. The cargo is fresh steel scrap, 20,000MT. Our recommended date of shipment is April 30th, 2019. Can we start negotiations on your part?

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for 20,000MT Ore Shipment from Chile to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Martinez,

We are pleased to assist you with the negotiation of our product offer. You can contact us via email or call us at +1234567890 for more information. We are happy to help with any arrangements or information you require.

Please confirm your date of shipment, and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Thank you and have a nice day.

Best regards,
Support Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for 20,000MT Ore Shipment from Chile to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

Thank you for confirming the shipment details from Chile to Antwerp, FCA, with a recommended shipment date of April 30th, 2019. Our team is currently reviewing your offer and will be in contact within the next 48 hours.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Valeriya

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for 20,000MT Ore Shipment from Chile to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Valeriya,

Thank you for your email regarding the offer. I would like to ask a few questions about the arrangements for our goods. Do you have any special requirements for the shipment? Are there any specific terms and conditions we need to consider?

As far as I understand, our offer is $70 per ton for the shipment of 20,000MT of fresh steel scrap.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Meeting in San Francisco
email_chain.body: Hi Julie, Please let me know when you will be in San Francisco. I would like to meet with you regarding our current Accounts Payable reconciliations issues. Best regards, Marko

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in 1099s and Payables Vouchers
email_chain.body: Hi Julie, We have recently received the 1099s for all of the vendors we pay on a monthly basis. It seems as though the information reported does not match the information reported on the payables vouchers. Please look into this immediately as we will be required to notify each of our vendors of the discrepancy. Please advise. Best Regards, Annette

email_chain.subject: Re: Discrepancy in 1099s and Payables Vouchers
email_chain.body: Hi Marko and Annette, I have received the email and the 1099s from Marko and Annette. Let me see if I can figure out what is going on. Is it possible that there is some sort of account error? I will get back to you tomorrow with my findings. Best Regards, Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Discrepancy in 1099s and Payables Vouchers
email_chain.body: Hi Andrew, I have been looking over the 1099s and accounts payables vouchers. Although the 1099 information and the accounts payables vouchers do not match, it does appear that the payables vouchers are correct. There seems to be an error in the 1099. How would the 1099 information get entered wrong? I was unable to find anything to indicate there was a discrepancy. Can you please look into this? Best Regards, Julie

email_chain.subject: Space Inquiry for Citrus Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Park,

Today, we are planning to pick up 5,600MT of citrus from Newport to Singapore. Would you have space available on your vessel for this shipment?

Thanks,
Phillip

email_chain.subject: Re: Space Inquiry for Citrus Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Park,

I have more than enough space on the vessel and can accommodate up to 8,000MT of oranges. Could you confirm if there are any other cargoes you would like to include in this shipment?

Thanks,
Phillip

email_chain.subject: Request for Metal Cutlery Tender
email_chain.body:
Mr. Park,

I have secured the flat sheets and will take those on. Could you include in my tender 3,000MT of metal cutlery?

Thanks,
Mr. Powell

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Metal Cutlery Tender
email_chain.body:
Mr. Powell,

Absolutely. We can provide you with 6,000MT of flat sheets. On the tender, you can also send your order for 4,000MT of metal cutlery. Could you confirm if there are any other cargoes you would like to include?

Thanks,
Phillip

labels.commodity: citrus, oranges, flat sheets, metal cutlery

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Status Update on Steel Plates Order
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Gualtieri,

I’m emailing to check the status of our order for 12,900MT of steel plates from Rotterdam to El País. We’re currently experiencing an issue with customs clearance and would like to find out how you’re dealing with this in the meantime.

We would appreciate an email back as soon as possible.

Regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Status Update on Steel Plates Order
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email regarding our port clearance issues.

Unfortunately, we haven’t been able to clear our shipment through customs due to COVID-19. We understand that this is due to increased security measures put in place by the government.

To ensure we are fully compliant with all necessary regulations, we will have to delay our delivery of your goods.

Our records show that we have been in communication regarding this matter but would like to confirm that our progress is on track.

If there is anything further you would like us to do in relation to this order or any other queries you may have, please do not hesitate to get in touch.

Best Regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Updated ETA for MS Mangrovia
email_chain.body:
Good morning Anders,

I have an updated ETA for the MS Mangrovia. I am expecting her on March 4th. I will update you with the port of discharge information once I know.

Yours truly,
Ricardo

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated ETA for MS Mangrovia
email_chain.body:
Yes, I believe her departure from Nantong will occur on the 4th of March. She is now 3 days ahead of schedule and is operating in the Taiwan Strait. I have included the arrival at Sydney below. 
Shanghai
Arrival Date: 03/04/18 10:00:00
Departure Date: 03/04/18 11:00:00
Arrival Time: 10:00 AM
Departure Time: 11:00 AM
Location: Port of Call
Updated: 03/04/2018
Regards, Tony

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated ETA for MS Mangrovia
email_chain.body: Good morning Anders, She will be arriving in the late morning/early afternoon, but not in the Anchorage Channel. Instead, we have scheduled her to berth at Shed No. 5 at the Shed No. 5 at Port of Sydney - this is also known as the St. Heliers Wharf. Regards, Tony

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated ETA for MS Mangrovia
email_chain.body:
G'day Anders,

If you could get your yard to transfer the hull, from 05 Shetland to Shed No. 5, we can then get her to push in for final handover. If that's not possible please advise.

Regards,
Tony

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Bernard,

Do dry ports exist in Vietnam? I need to send around 4,000 kgs of auto parts from Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC) to Dalat, just passing through. Could you provide an estimate of the charges?

Thank you,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Jack,

Thank you for your email. Yes, Vietnam does have dry ports. There is an import office called Sava, located at Hai Phong Port. The service charge for Sava is $100 USD per 40’ container. However, we don’t have many customers using Sava, as we don’t provide special handling for duties.

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Bernard

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Bernard. It sounds like we should not use Sava. Is the tariff $1,650 per container? The website states $600 per container. Is that the total cost, or just the charge for Sava?

Thanks,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Hi Bernard,

Thank you for the information. The charges for your services seem reasonable, but I still need to verify the final quotation. Could you advise on that?

Also, I need to confirm the payment terms. Is it 30% before shipping the container, with the balance due upon arrival in Cambodia?

Thank you.

Best regards,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Hello Bernard,

Thanks again for the information on your services. I still need to review the quotation. Could you send it to me in PDF format?

Thanks,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Hi Bernard,

Thank you for sending the PDF file. I still need to review the quotation. Could you also provide details on the port of loading in China and the transit time?

Thanks,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Bernard,

Thank you very much for all the information. I have been researching various options, including Sava Customs clearance. Is it correct that we have to use Sava? If not, could you suggest an alternative? I have two cargo shipments from my warehouse in Korea (Dong Ha Port) that I would like to send to Cambodia.

Thanks,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Hi Bernard,

Could you please provide an estimate of the costs for your services? I also have a few questions:
1. Does the information I provided include your services? If not, how much will it cost?
2. Are import duties excluded?

Thank you,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Dry Ports in Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Bernard,

Thank you for all the information on the services you can provide. Could you also let me know the time of loading the container?

Best regards,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Robb,

Could you provide a freight estimate for 28,000 MT of sugar from São Vicente to Cádiz in early July? We would appreciate any assistance you can provide.

Kind regards,
Sue

email_chain.subject: Request for Carrier Quote
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Robb,

We are seeking a carrier to transport 10 containers from the Americas to the Mediterranean in May. Could you provide us with a quote for a suitable vessel?

Thank you.

Kind regards,
Nancy

email_chain.subject: Possible Cargo for Mid-June Window
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We have a possible cargo for the mid-June window, requiring urgent handling within seven days.

Port of loading and draft:
- Al Khobar: 15-16 meters
- Zeebrugge: 13.2 meters

Weight: 6,600 MT of LSHS.

Discharge port:
- Port of Balikpapan (Balikpapan, Indonesia)

ETA to discharge port: Mid-May 2023.

Please do not hesitate to reply.

Thank you,
Mr. Chen

email_chain.subject: RE: Possible Cargo for Mid-June Window
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I am sorry that you didn’t receive my email regarding the possible cargo for mid-June. Please confirm receipt.

Thank you,
Mr. Chen

email_chain.subject: Canceled Suez Transit for Balikpapan Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zee,

In response to your email, the IMO only allows the Suez Canal transit vessel to transit within 24 hours after the loading of LSHS. This is too tight a time for the scheduled sailing window of the cargo ship to the Indies.

Best regards,
Mr. Chen
Manager, International Trade Department

email_chain.subject: Cargo to the North of Borneo from Bangladesh
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

We are transporting a cargo to the northern part of Borneo from Bangladesh. Please advise on the feasibility and any constraints.

Best regards,
Mr. Zee

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Negotiation for Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. X,

Thank you for your quote. Your freight rate is too high, and we need a 5,000MT shipment of soybeans from Houston to Santos within the next 10 days. Are you able to hold some space for us and offer us the same rate?

Sincerely,
Mr. Y

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Freight Rate Negotiation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. X,

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to follow up on my previous email regarding the 5,000MT shipment of soybeans from Houston to Santos. We are still in need of a competitive rate and would appreciate it if you could confirm the availability of space.

Sincerely,
Mr. Y

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Freight Rate and Space Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. X,

This is a gentle reminder regarding our urgent requirement for a 5,000MT shipment of soybeans from Houston to Santos. We need to finalize the arrangements within the next 10 days. Please let us know if you can accommodate our request and offer a revised rate.

Sincerely,
Mr. Y

email_chain.subject: Final Follow-Up on Soybean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. X,

I am following up one last time regarding the 5,000MT soybean shipment from Houston to Santos. We are under a tight deadline and need to confirm the space and rate as soon as possible. Please let us know your final offer.

Sincerely,
Mr. Y

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Coffee Beans
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mrs. Min,

Could you please provide a quote for shipping 400 kg of coffee beans from Shanghai to Paris? I need the rate for next month, and it should include delivery to my city.

Nicole

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Coffee Beans
email_chain.body:
Dear Nicole,

Thank you for your inquiry. The cost for shipping 400 kg of coffee beans from Shanghai to Paris is approximately $400. However, we can offer a 40% discount, bringing the total to $240. This discounted rate will be reflected in your final invoice.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Mrs. Min

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:

I’m working on an export of bulk wheat from Mina Al Ahmar to Ensenada. Could you provide me with a freight quote, and is that for regular service or LC?

Regards,
Lea

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:
Hi Lea,

Thanks for your email. I have attached our Mexican market page with all our destinations and fees. The quote for 500 tonnes is as follows: $4,500.00 plus V.A.T.

Regards,
Ms. Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Taylor,

Thank you so much for your quote. Would that be less for refrigerated service? I would need to ship within the next couple of days but refrigerated service could be up to 20 days later.

Regards,
Lea

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:
Hi Lea,

Thank you for your message. For that port, we can offer refrigerated service with the reefer speed in 12 days, so the FCL with this speed will be delivered in less than 20 days.

Regards,
Ms. Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Taylor,

Thank you. Could I have the FOB price for 4000 tons of wheat also? Can we make a prepaid payment or do you charge an initial payment? What kind of rates do you have for this service? I would also like to know the inland charge of $1.50 from port to consumer. Are there any restrictions on grade, or certificates required?

Regards,
Lea

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:
Hi Lea,

Please, could you send me an email with the grade that you will need for the purchase? Also, if you want, I can attach a sample of the certificate to send to the consumer.

Regards,
Ms. Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Export
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Taylor,

We will be needing the following grade:
1027--410, 2554--320, 3044--330

Any additional certificates needed? Will the wheat need to be in barge? We will also need to know the origin of the wheat.

Regards,
Lea

email_chain.subject: Urgent: File Printing Request
email_chain.body: Hey Aaron, it's Chris here from the back office team. We've received an important message from one of the senior managers. She asked if you could stop by your manager's office during your lunch break to check if all files are ready to print. Please let me know once you've completed this task. Thanks, Chris.

email_chain.subject: Missing Files for Printing
email_chain.body: Hey Aaron, we just received an email indicating that some files we need are missing from your folder. These were scheduled to be printed today, but they aren't ready yet. The manager wants this resolved as soon as possible. Thanks, Chris.

email_chain.subject: Re: Missing Files for Printing
email_chain.body: Hey Chris, my manager hasn't instructed me to print any files today. I'll check on this as soon as I return to my office. Thanks, Aaron.

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on File Printing
email_chain.body: Hey Aaron, the manager asked me to follow up on whether you've finished printing the files. It seems there might have been a miscommunication. If you're unable to print them today, please ensure they are labeled and ready to be printed first thing tomorrow. Thanks, Chris.

email_chain.subject: Office Number Request
email_chain.body: Hey Aaron, I'm the new guy in the office, and it seems I don't have your office number. Could you please share it with me? Thanks, Chris.

email_chain.subject: Request for Rate Ideas and Vessel Flexibility
email_chain.body: Sven, We’re interested in 10,000MT of chemicals from Hamburg to Gdansk. Could you send your rate ideas, and is your vessel flexible on partial loading windows? Sincerely, Louis

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Rate Ideas and Vessel Flexibility
email_chain.body: Hi Louis, Great to hear from you. Our colleagues have just reviewed your email, and have arrived at the following response: 'Sorry, but we are unable to load your chemicals from Hamburg to Gdansk. Please also inform us when the vessels are available for loading, and if you have any special requirements. Our reference to a standard rate was purely for information.' Thank you. Sven

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Rate Ideas and Vessel Flexibility
email_chain.body: Sven, That is totally unacceptable! You have failed to respond to our enquiry, and have refused to discuss our specific needs with your office. We have therefore taken the decision to engage an alternative freight forwarder for our chemicals. Best wishes, Louis

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Rate Ideas and Vessel Flexibility
email_chain.body: Hi Louis, Our company has just reviewed our contractual agreements with your company, and we are very disappointed to hear that this can be your standard response. Best regards, Sven

email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Shipping Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Mica Ore Shipment from Murmansk to Japan/China

Thanks for your reply. I have re-read our contract carefully. Do you still need me to sign it? I am ready to ship your cargo as soon as I get your signed contract and other documents, like bills of lading, air waybill, etc. Please let me know as soon as possible.

Thanks,
Osvaldo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Mica Ore Shipment from Murmansk to Japan/China
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Shipping Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Mica Ore Shipment from Murmansk to Japan/China
email_chain.body:
We still need to know when your price will be available, and if your price could be higher than quoted by your competitor and if there would be other documents required in addition to the price. I am expecting your reply by tomorrow.

Osvaldo

email_chain.subject: Sulphuric Acid Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Karina,

Thank you for your sulphuric acid enquiry. Based on our past experiences, most vessels from Antwerp take 10-12 days to arrive in Houston. Additionally, most vessels are fully loaded for India with sulphuric acid as a ballast cargo, which results in lower revenue for the vessel and consequently higher freight costs. I would recommend using a break-bulk vessel to optimize freight costs, especially given the uncertainty regarding international economic conditions. Please advise on your shipper requirements and if you would like a quotation.

Kind regards,
Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Sulphuric Acid Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

Thank you for your response and the quote that you provided. The distance from India is 8,325 nautical miles. We would appreciate if you could kindly provide a detailed quotation for shipping one (1) unit (21.3 cubic meters) of sulphuric acid at 1.32 MW+ acid based on shipper specifications at a FCA Houston port.

Kind regards,
Karina

Our attention: Jon, Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Sulphuric Acid Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Karina,

Thanks for your follow-up. I have received your updated enquiry and have already emailed it to our contact in India who will be able to provide you with a detailed quotation.

Thank you,
Jon

email_chain.subject: Opportunity for Sale of MS High Hope
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

I am writing to inform you about the opportunity to purchase the MS High Hope. As detailed in the attached document, the vessel is in excellent condition and requires no further investment. It is a fully operational and modern ship, previously purchased by the shipyard with a capacity of 36,000t and equipped with 12M2 of advanced equipment. The vessel underwent a thorough inspection earlier this year, including engine cleaning, and is now ready for its new owners. Please feel free to contact me for further details.

Best regards,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Ship Purchase
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir or Madam,

Best regards,
[Name not provided]

email_chain.subject: Quotation Request for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Good morning, Robby.

We would like to get a quotation for the transport of 10,000MT of crude oil from Port Louis to Toliara. This is a regular cargo from our company, and we are looking forward to finding a reliable and punctual partner on this lane.

Can you provide us with an early estimate?

Warm regards,
Dan

email_chain.subject: Re: Quotation Request for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Dan,

I see you’re looking for quotes for the transport of crude oil from Port Louis to Toliara. I have followed up with our sales representative, who advised me that they have spoken to you about this cargo. I have just confirmed with him that we do have a crew member in Port Louis and a vessel arriving on 01/02. I have also been informed that we will have to use our own vessel (cargo vessel) to transport the cargo to Toliara. I have contacted our vessel with this information, and they have responded positively to this arrangement and have confirmed their availability to complete the work.

We will be able to provide you with a quotation by the end of today, as I would like to first meet with my boss to ensure this is correct in terms of the operation before sending you our quote.

Regards,
Robby

email_chain.subject: Re: Quotation Request for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Dan,

Thanks for contacting us with your quotation request. I have confirmed with my boss, and the quotation you will receive will be as follows:

Route: PL-MRW
Arrival Port: Port Louis
Departure Port: Antsirabe
ETA: 03/02/2009
Crew: 3 sailors
Fare: $4000 per sailor
Voyage: 07 days
VOCSURV(+) in La Reunion
Departure from Port Louis on 03/02/2009

Transport costs (0.5% per day x 10,000MT): $500
Total cost: $6500

We will send you the bill in PDF format via email.

Kind regards,
Robby

email_chain.subject: Request for Daywork Rate and Weekend Berth Restrictions
email_chain.body:
We’re looking to ship 1,500MT of LPG from Rotterdam to Montreal. Could you please confirm the current “Daywork” rate and request any weekend berth restrictions for our final calculations?

Sincerely,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Daywork Rate and Weekend Berth Restrictions
email_chain.body:
Hi Melissa,

We currently have a single tanker available for this date, the Baltic Sky. However, the weekend rate for a shipment of that size is 120 US$/MT. As you know, this exceeds your Daywork cap of 100US$/MT. Could you please provide more information on the exact timing of this cargo for us to be able to offer a more accurate quote?

Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Request for Weekend Rates and Delivery Timing
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,

Please let me know what your weekend rates are for August to cover our 4,000MT from Riga to Rotterdam. We’ve got an MV that is leaving for ROU on the 16th and needs a 3-day turnaround. Any ideas how we could drop the delivery to the early morning of the 19th?

Best regards,
Leandro

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Weekend Rates and Delivery Timing
email_chain.body:
Hi Leandro,

We're currently 100% booked for August. Unfortunately, we can't offer anything to you for the early morning of the 19th. However, if you would like to deliver the cargo on a Saturday or a Sunday instead, we might have something for you. Please let me know if you're interested.

Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Weekend Rates and Delivery Timing
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,

Sorry about that. We're pretty flexible on this one. We can cut the load by 500MT to a total of 3,500MT and leave from the 19th morning. We also have the capacity for another tanker to come.

Regards,
Leandro

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Weekend Rates and Delivery Timing
email_chain.body:
Hi Leandro,

Unfortunately, I'm afraid we don't have any available dates for your requirements at the moment. The Baltic Sky will arrive in Rotterdam on the 25th. However, we might be able to offer you a date for the 29th. Please confirm if this is something you're interested in?

Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Weekend Rates and Delivery Timing
email_chain.body:
Hey Jonas,

We're in for the 29th.

Regards,
Leandro

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Weekend Rates and Delivery Timing
email_chain.body:
Hi Leandro,

I have forwarded your request to our scheduler. They'll get in touch with you as soon as a possible booking confirmation is available. If you have any questions in the meantime, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Wheat Delivery to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

Thank you for your enquiry. We should be able to arrange the wheat delivery to Barcelona next week. However, I must inform you that our normal laycan is 28 days.

If you would like to confirm the details, please feel free to give me a call.

Best regards,
Yancey

email_chain.subject: Update on Wheat Delivery to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

As promised, I spoke with Mr. James regarding your request for a faster delivery time. He informed me that, due to our customer's particularly busy schedule this week, we can now fill your order in 21 days from the day after you receive this email.

I will call you next Monday to finalize the details.

Thank you for your patience!

Best regards,
Jill

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 12,500MT of Paper Rolls
email_chain.body:
Ms. Smith,

Ship 3764 leaves Hamburg on May 9 and arrives in New Orleans on May 15. Would you be able to arrange this for 12,500MT of paper rolls from Hamburg to New Orleans? We need to get these on a vessel as soon as possible.

Regards,
Kurt

email_chain.subject: Request for Email Scan
email_chain.body:
Ms. Smith,

Thank you so much for the emails! I really appreciate the help. My friend in Sweden wants a scan of these emails. Would you be able to email these to me at [email protected]? I can then forward this information to my friend's department. Thanks again!

Paul

email_chain.subject: Update on Shipping Arrangements
email_chain.body:
Ms. Smith,

Thank you for getting back to me. We're still working on this. I have another idea to contact another supplier. I have checked their line to Hamburg and I'm sure we can work something out. Thanks again!

Paul

email_chain.subject: Urgent Update on Paper Rolls
email_chain.body:
Paul,

I am very sorry for the late reply, but I was traveling in Hamburg this week. I have some urgent news. The company has offered to give us the 12,500 MT of paper rolls from Hamburg for free, which is great! All the arrangements are in place with our supplier. All the suppliers for our project have been confirmed. I have also spoken to a colleague in New Orleans about the project. I can send you more information if needed.

Best regards,
Ms. Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Update on Paper Rolls
email_chain.body:
Ms. Smith,

I really appreciate your help. There were 12,500 MT of paper rolls to be arranged, but it seems like they are no longer needed. Thank you anyway!

Paul

email_chain.subject: Final Confirmation on Paper Rolls
email_chain.body:
Paul,

I am glad we found a solution for the 12,500 MT of paper rolls. I will send the email about it. Could you please forward it to my colleague? If you do, please send it to [email protected]. Thanks!

Best regards,
Ms. Smith

email_chain.subject: Final Price for Paper Rolls
email_chain.body:
Paul,

3. Do you manage bunkers on owners’ accounts?

Please let me know your availability and response.

Cheers,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Shipbroking Enquiries
email_chain.body:
Hi Andy,

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to follow up on the enquiries Jane mentioned earlier:

1. Are you handling cargo sales with fixed rates?
2. Can you arrange shipment to Ceylon ASAP?
3. Do you manage bunkers on owners’ accounts?

Additionally, I thought you might find it interesting to explore investment opportunities in the Indian market. Perhaps we could discuss this further if you’re interested.

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Bunker Charges Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

We are looking to ship 7,000MT of soybeans from New Orleans to Poland. Could you let me know what the current bunker charges are to Ashdod?

Regards,
Isabella

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Charges Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Isabella,

The bunker costs to Ashdod from New Orleans are about $35/MT. This is based on the previous usage data that was compiled. So, we can expect the actual bunker charges to be closer to that amount.

However, please be advised that we currently do not have that type of bunker data from Poland, so it is hard to know for sure without having access to the actual bunker records.

In any case, the information you received from the last time we discussed this scenario was likely an estimate.

Please let me know if you need further details.

Best regards,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Charges Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

My client was recently asking how much we will need to pay for bunker charges from New Orleans to Ashdod for 7,000 MT of soybeans.

I've already informed him that we would need to estimate the cost. Therefore, I would really appreciate it if you could provide an estimate.

Thanks,
Valentina

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Charges Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Valentina,

Please be advised that the bunker costs from New Orleans to Ashdod will likely be around $35/MT. However, this is just an estimate and the actual costs may vary depending on various factors.

I would recommend that you reach out to a reliable company that deals with bunker charges for more accurate information.

You can also contact your local port authority or the port in Ashdod directly to get an idea of the bunker costs.

I hope this helps and let me know if you require further assistance.

Kind regards,
Gary

Our freight forwarders can quote a CIF rate from Fujairah to Dammam. Our client is open to use Dammam or Dhuabh port in Saudi Arabia for unloading the fertilisers. We would like to arrange shipment of your products for the month of May 2009. Please advise your earliest availability as per your schedule.

Yours truly,
Ali bin Ahmed
Ali FZC
P.O. Box 75264
Sharjah, United Arab Emirates

email_chain.body:
The cargo may be loaded by the shipper to the next best charter rate.

Please let me know how your customer expects to do business with this opportunity, that is, if you could provide an offer based on the proposal submitted. We are looking for weekly spot shipment but it could be FOB as the availability is just weekly spot basis.

How do you prefer us to do business? I guess it will be based on your offer as per our proposal submission.
If that is the case, the offer shall be submitted based on your shipper’s current or top charter rates.

In case you prefer to go by the proposal submitted, then we need to send to the client a revised proposal based on your current charter rates.

P.S. This email refers to “Email 1” and “Email 2” sent on 5 Jul 2017 and 5 Jul 2017.

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: Shipping Organic Corn from HKG to LA
email_chain.body:
Dear Daniel,

Your proposal has been processed and the new quote is attached. Kindly review it. Please let me know whether you would like to proceed or not.

Regards,
Duy

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: Shipping Organic Corn from HKG to LA
email_chain.body:
Daniel,

Kindly confirm the commitment for us. We will book the shipping.

As we informed you, our side we are not ready to confirm the shipping only until we receive the FOB quote from your end. So please revert once as we are waiting for your offer.

Once you revert with the FOB quote, we can inform our buyer with the price as well as shipping rates.

Since it’s a quick response, we need your clarification. Can you please confirm as to whether we can send out the request and send your firm rate along with a detailed invoice for shipping to enable the buyer to commit with the volume?

Once we receive your commitment from the buyer, we will proceed with forwarding the cargo.

Thank you in advance.
Kindly revert.

Best Regards,
Sujal

email_chain.subject: Loading Schedule for Crude Oil
email_chain.body: Hi Lisa, We are loading 3000 MT of crude oil today from Marseille to Beirut. Our earliest available berth in Marseille is Tuesday 27th July. Could you confirm your ETA for tonight and let me know if Thursday or Friday are acceptable? Best, Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Schedule for Crude Oil
email_chain.body: Dear Gary, We are on our way to Beaune and will likely have an ETA for your port around 2200 local time. As our equipment needs to be unloaded at Beaune it would be better if we could unload in Marseille. We will be available in Marseille from Thursday 29th July. If you have a vessel available in Beirut, could we use that to offload our equipment? Best, Karen

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability in Marseille
email_chain.body: Dear Lisa, We have a vessel available to unload in Marseille on Saturday 31st July. It will be a slower vessel as it is our own. We will still have our ETA for your port around 2200 local time. What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be? Best, Gary

email_chain.subject: Update on Unloading Schedule
email_chain.body: Dear Lisa, We have had a delay in unloading at Beaune due to the strong winds. We are in port at Beaune and we hope to have a crane available for unloading in the next few hours. I have also just received confirmation that we have a vessel available in Marseille on Monday 2nd August. The ETA for your port will be around 2200 local time. Are you still looking for us to unload on Saturday 31st July? What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be? Best, Gary

email_chain.subject: Arrival in Marseille
email_chain.body: Dear Lisa, We have just landed in Marseille and we will be able to unload in the next few hours. Are you still looking for us to unload on Saturday 31st July? What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be? What instructions to follow for your lashing and should we wait for the final confirmation of weather? Best, Gary

email_chain.subject: Email Parsing Issue
email_chain.body:
So this email sort of always becomes:
Email 1: Date1 Body
Email B 1: Date1 Body
<Email 2>: Date2 Body
Email B 2: Date2 Body
<Email 2>: Date3 Body

How would you recommend that I parse these emails to ensure that if there are multiple emails with the same date, the earliest date will be picked and the other emails are ignored. I think if you look at the way I have the email on the above email there is no check for duplicate dates.

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Parsing Issue
email_chain.body: Or perhaps it is an easier question to ask in how would you recommend that I parse these emails to ensure that if there are multiple emails with the same date, the first email with that date is picked and the other emails are ignored.

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Parsing Issue
email_chain.body: What is the language?

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Parsing Issue
email_chain.body: Would you recommend that I leave these emails as I have above in the string (there are hundreds of them that I am looking to find out if it is possible to apply some regex to find this first email with that date?

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Parsing Issue
email_chain.body:
So far I have come up with something similar to this to parse it, but I think there is an easier way:

import re

regex_date = r"\[.+\]"

emails = '<Email 1>\nDate1: 11/8/2015, 11:45:26 AM\n[Email B 1]: Date1: 11/8/2015, 11:45:26 AM\n<Date 2>\nDate2: 11/8/2015, 1:12:19 PM\n[Email B 2]: Date2: 11/8/2015
>11/8/2015, 1:17:48 PM\n<Date 3>\nDate3: 11/8/2015, 1:33:42 PM\n[Email B 3]: Date3: 11/8/2015, 1:33:42 PM\n<Date 4>\nDate4: 11/8/2015, 1:33:42 PM\n[Email B 4]: Date4: 11/8/2015, 1:33:42 PM'

emails = emails.split('\n')

emails = emails[2:13]
new_emails = []

for i in emails:
if i == "":
new_emails.append('')

regex_date = r"(\[[\d\-:\.\n]+])"

for email in new_emails:
print(email)

regex = r'(\[[\d'

email_chain.subject: Project Progress Update
email_chain.body:
Hi Karen,

How is everything going with your work? This is a great project, but if there's anything we can do for you, let us know! Please tell us what you think of the progress.

Jean

email_chain.subject: Checking In on Your First Month
email_chain.body:
Hi Karen,

Hope your Sunday is going well! I wanted to check in on how things are going with your first month. I know this can be a challenging time for people who've just switched jobs. That's why I wanted to check in with you and see how you're doing. I'd love to hear from you soon.

Best regards,
Stacey

email_chain.subject: New Product Launch Feedback
email_chain.body:
Good morning Karen,

It looks like you had a great launch for your new product! I was excited to see the video, and I know this product has the potential to transform lives. I just wanted to check in with you and see how you're feeling about it. It's normal to feel overwhelmed with a new product, but remember, this product is amazing, and you can use it as a tool to help your customers succeed. If you ever need to talk, just let me know.

Best regards,
Jean

Hi Luke,

I could not reach you yesterday, however I will forward you the payment terms document at once.

I would prefer the full payment, but if that is not an option, we could also opt for an installment payment plan.

I would be glad to have your expert advice on this.

Best regards,
Abubakar Al-Abdu

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Abubakar,

Thank you for the emails.

We can do full payment or installment payment plan.

We will send the payment terms documents for you to review.

Regards,
Luke

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Luke,

I prefer the installment payment plan. I could receive 5% of the total contract amount as the first installment.

Additionally, I could send you the payment schedule after you forward me the contract documents.

The total contract amount for this project is 25,000,000,000 (twenty-five billion naira).

Best regards,
Abubakar Al-Abdu

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for Chemical Products

We received your e-mail of 6th March with your company's offer. We are quite impressed with your rate.

Please confirm that you can provide 3,500MT of iron ore cargo. Our acceptance will be for a 25-day time charter for one 8,000DWT iron ore cargo at $16.5 per metric ton, on an AF & F basis to Goa.

Kind regards,
Fernando

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Chemical Products Charter
email_chain.body:

Fernando

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Iron Ore Cargo

email_chain.subject: Request for Cargo Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Matt,

You mentioned on our last call that you’d be interested in switching some plastic resin for steel coils from Taiwan to Hamburg and loading by the end of the week. We’re wondering if you’d be able to tell us your cargo details so we can give you a quote.

Thanks,
Jeffrey

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Previous Email
email_chain.body:
Hi Matt,

I sent you an email a few minutes ago. It should arrive in the next couple of minutes. If you do not receive it, please let us know.

Thanks,
Jeffrey

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Previous Email
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeffrey,

I didn't receive your email. Can you resend?

Thanks,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Previous Email
email_chain.body:
Hi Matt,

I just sent you another email. Please check your inbox.

Thanks,
Jeffrey

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Previous Email
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeffrey,

Another problem. I don't have an email account. I've sent you an email with my contact details.

Thanks,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Previous Email
email_chain.body:
Hi Matt,

Your email arrived at my Inbox at 2pm. I sent you a follow-up.

Thanks,
Jeffrey

email_chain.subject: Assistance with Email Account
email_chain.body:
Hi Matt,

Sorry to hear that you don't have an email account. Please don't hesitate to contact us if we can be of any assistance.

As stated in our last email, we are in the process of setting up an account for you and will have it set up and ready for use in the next few days. In the meantime, please feel free to use the email addresses for yourself and any of our contacts provided in this email.

Thanks for contacting us and we look forward to seeing you back online soon.

Let us know if there's anything else you need.

Regards,
Jeffrey

email_chain.subject: Re: Assistance with Email Account
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeffrey,

Thanks for your email. I received it at 2pm yesterday. I'm pleased to hear that you're planning on reopening your email. I'll pass your request.

Thanks,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Proposal for 5,000mt Voyage from Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kim,

Would you consider a 5,000mt voyage of 20-ft. ISO containers loaded with electronics, toys, and arts from Singapore to Zaragoza?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for 5,000mt Voyage from Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Thank you for your email. We are happy to transport your commodities via sea-freight. Please kindly provide your shipment details.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Shipment Details for 5,000mt Voyage
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

Thank you for your swift response. I am sending you the shipment details of our commodities in the attachment.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Details for 5,000mt Voyage
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

I have reviewed your email and the attached shipment details. It sounds good to us. Do you have the Certificate of Origin (CoO)?

We are planning to ship your commodities to Spain on 12 August.

Have a good day.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Certificate of Origin (CoO) for Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

Thank you for your email. I just sent you the CoO for the exports from Singapore to Spain. I also want to know if it will be possible for you to transport the following commodities: Consumer Goods; Toys; Electronics; Industrial Components; Metal Products; Fabricated Metals; Automotive Parts; Ores; and Agriculture Products.

Please advise me at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Certificate of Origin (CoO) for Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We have received your email and the Certificate of Origin. However, we regret to inform you that we cannot ship your commodities to Spain. As you know, the US and the EU are not currently in a free trade agreement (FTA).

Best regards,
Stella

labels.commodity: Electronics, Toys, Arts, Consumer Goods, Industrial Components, Metal Products, Fabricated Metals, Automotive Parts, Ores, Agriculture Products

email_chain.subject: Request for Transit Time and Freight Rate
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tyler,

We’re moving 4,500MT of metal scrap from Manila to Port Kelang. Could you advise a basic transit time and a freight rate based on FIO terms?

Kind regards,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Transit Time and Price
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tyler,

Could you please advise the status of the email I sent last week regarding transit time and price? Thank you.

Best regards,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Status of Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tyler,

Could you please advise me what happened to my quote?

Regards,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Crane Cost and Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tyler,

Thank you very much for getting back to us. Could you please let me know when your receiver can sign for the shipment? As per your advice, we had to hire a crane and move the scrap to the container and are holding it for the 10 days currently. Would you mind sending the cost of the crane by e-mail as we have to pay it today?

Thank you for your patience. I look forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,
Matt

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Request for Petrol Shipment from Rotterdam to Marseille
email_chain.body: We need to arrange the shipment of 50MT of petrol from Rotterdam to Marseille within the next three weeks. Please confirm your availability and provide a quote for this shipment. Let us know if there are any specific requirements or conditions we need to consider. We look forward to your prompt response. Thank you for your cooperation. Best regards, Logistics Team.

email_chain.subject: Request for Petrol Shipment from Marseille to Berlin
email_chain.body: We have received your request and are currently reviewing it. Additionally, we need to arrange a shipment of 40MT of petrol from Marseille to Berlin within two weeks. Could you please confirm if this is feasible? We will provide a detailed quote once we have all the necessary information. Thank you for your understanding. Best regards, Operations Team.

email_chain.subject: Discussion on Potential Merger
email_chain.body: We need to discuss a potential merger between our two companies. I have attached the details of the merger proposal for your review. There are some conditions that need to be considered, particularly regarding staff numbers. According to the proposal, the number of staff at the German company has to be double the number of staff at our company. Please review the attached document and let us know your thoughts. Best regards, Merger Team.

email_chain.subject: Improving Shipping Efficiency
email_chain.body: Hi Evie, thanks for your message! I'm currently working on the TMA1 report and exploring ways to enhance our shipping process efficiency. Currently, I use email to communicate with Yazaki for order and scheduling inquiries. However, I've heard that competitors like Yasakawa use different methods. Could we discuss this further? Your insights would be invaluable for my assignment. Looking forward to your suggestions! Best, Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Improving Shipping Efficiency
email_chain.body: Hello Maria, I recently had a discussion with Yousef, the owner of Yazaki, about a potential collaboration. He expressed interest in our shipping process, and I shared some research I found on booking shipping, which has seen significant changes recently. I'm not sure if this is directly helpful, but perhaps we can explore these ideas further? Best, Evie

email_chain.subject: Re: Improving Shipping Efficiency
email_chain.body: Hi Evie, thank you for sharing your discussion with Yousef. It sounds like there's potential for collaboration and learning from each other's processes. Could you facilitate a conversation with Yousef about his suggestions? It would be great to explore how we can integrate these ideas into our current system to improve efficiency. Looking forward to your thoughts. Best, Maria

email_chain.subject: Order Confirmation and Sailing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bader,

We’d like to confirm our order of 120,000MT of Avi base oil from Rotterdam to Dalian. Do you know of any sailings open next week that we could take advantage of?

Regards,
Marc

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Confirmation and Sailing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Marc,

Yes, we have 2 Avi x-mor bases available in Rotterdam next week. One goes to Felixstowe, arriving Monday March 10th, and the other one goes to Hamburg, arriving Tuesday March 11th.

Regards,
Jerome

email_chain.subject: Freight and Transit Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Jerome,

Thanks for the quick response. Can you tell me what the freight will be and what transit time is anticipated?

Regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight and Transit Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

The charter is priced at 3100 MTCF, and if it’s a 12m tank and 2m cargo hold, it will take 10 days to get from Rotterdam to the US Gulf Coast.

Regards,
Jerome

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight and Transit Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you. Our team has started to draw up the offer for cargo purchase. We will expect the charter back to us soon.

Regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Charter and Offer Preparation
email_chain.body:
I’m attaching the charter as requested. Can you please have the offer ready for us next week?

Regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter and Offer Preparation
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

Our client has agreed to sign the contract.

Regards,
Jerome

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Weekend Loadings and Dock Delays
email_chain.body:
Hi Lucia,

We plan to move 2,900MT of wheat from Victoria to Portland. Could you let me know if weekend loadings incur an extra fee, and do you anticipate any dock delays?

Warmly,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Weekend Loadings and Dock Delays
email_chain.body:
Hi Helena,

As we plan to ship several loads to this terminal in a short period of time, we will have at least one vessel to keep both lanes operating smoothly. For this week, we have the following schedule:

- Lane 1 will be busy from Monday to Friday. WL5 will be used on Thursday and Friday.
- WL7 is booked from Friday to Monday.
- WL5 and WL6 will be used on Monday and Tuesday.
- WL6 will be used on Wednesday and Thursday.

This schedule should keep both lanes open 100% of the time. I apologize for any inconvenience, but this is our best solution to maintain operations.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Kind regards,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Updated Invoice Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Lucia,

Based on your updated response, I’ve changed the TO and FW of our invoice to indicate [Portland OR Inbound] along with [Terminal Docking Bay]. Thank you for the clarification!

Kind regards,
Cheryl

email_chain.subject: Re: A Question About Your Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

I would recommend reaching out to your customer services team directly. It sounds like there might be a situation where a step was missed or the documentation needed for the export is incorrect.

Sending with kindness,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Questions about your reply to my email
email_chain.body:
Hello Diana,

Thank you for your response.

Best regards,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Styrene Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jim,

We have 9,100MT of styrene available for shipment from Singapore to Manila. Could you provide me with a ballpark rate as soon as possible? Additionally, is a partial load feasible?

Best,
Rebecca

email_chain.subject: Re: Styrene Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jim,

Thank you for your reply. I have another styrene inquiry: 1,050MT at FOB Zeebrugge, with a 40-day timeline. Could you please confirm if this will be a problem?

Best,
Rebecca

email_chain.subject: Re: Styrene Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jim,

Thank you for the offer. I am not sure if you received my previous email, but I am very interested in your offer. Could you please send me the Letter of Intent (LOI) and the commercial invoice?

Best,
Rebecca

email_chain.subject: Re: Styrene Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jim,

We will handle the necessary documents. Please let us know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Best,
Rebecca

email_chain.subject: Booking Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mrs. Perkins,

I’d like to arrange delivery of 10,000 tonnes of sugar for shipment from Shanghai to Vancouver. Your schedule for the coming month indicates that the Venus will be free for that size of load around 11 February. Could you confirm my booking, or if not, recommend another suitable vessel?

Many thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
That’ll be fine, I think. A nice fat cargo of sugar, will be on sale all over Vancouver by the time it reaches. As you say, the Venus is ideal for your load, it’ll sail on 6 February, it’ll be there on 12 February. A big, high volume, reliable ship; there won’t be any holdups, I’m sure. There’s no need to put the freight in in advance, just send the invoices to myself, once everything’s sorted I’ll make sure the rest of the paperwork goes smoothly.

Thanks again,
John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Request for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Many thanks for the details, I have shipped a cargo of Spanish Sherry, on behalf of a Spanish gentleman. I will happily forward on the relevant invoices once I have confirmed with you when it will arrive.

I’ll make a note of the details you’ve sent me, and I’ll check the port records as soon as we arrive back at sea.

email_chain.subject: Berth Inquiry for Mars
email_chain.body:
Good morning, do you have the berth for the Mars ready? That would be for the shipment from the Elephant River to Durban on Saturday the 23rd of February.

Many thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Berth Inquiry for Mars
email_chain.body: That’ll be fine, yes, the Mars will be arriving on time, expect the Maasai to be in the south end of harbour, ready for you at the appointed time. The Maasai is an old, reliable cargo vessel, don’t be concerned about the holds, they’ve got plenty of room, you can store as much cargo as you need in that one. I’ve also been in touch with Mr. Hodge to confirm that the Maasai’s captain.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 1,000MT Brake Fluid Shipment from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Chris,

We’re looking to arrange a 1,000MT cargo of brake fluid from Port Said to Mombasa. What’s the latest turnaround time for this route, and does your daily service schedule align with our estimated arrival date?

Regards,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1,000MT Brake Fluid Shipment from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Thanks for reaching out. As mentioned in our previous email, our turnaround time for this route is typically around 4-5 days. However, it can be shorter or longer depending on a variety of factors, including logistics, customs clearance, and terminal delays. Please note that our service schedule is typically twice a week, but we can accommodate changes or exceptions if necessary.

I have also attached our latest price list for your reference.

Kind regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1,000MT Brake Fluid Shipment from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Bobby,

Thank you for the prompt response. Our vessel will be arriving on 15 April, and we are looking for a prompt shipment. Is it possible to expedite the turnaround time? We have a pressing deadline, and every day counts.

Please also let me know if there are any additional charges that we need to consider.

Thanks again,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1,000MT Brake Fluid Shipment from Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

Thanks for your email. Yes, we can expedite the turnaround time for your shipment. We can arrange for the cargo to be loaded and transported to the port as early as possible to ensure a shorter turnaround time. Additionally, we can prioritize the shipment and ensure that all necessary customs and logistics processes are handled smoothly to expedite the overall turnaround time. However, please note that there may be additional charges involved for expedited services.

Please let me know if you have any further questions or if I can provide any additional information.

Thanks again for your business.

Janelle

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo
email_chain.body:
Simon,

Could you please suggest the name of a vessel to transport 4,000MT of cargo from Shanghai to Sri Lanka? Additionally, let me know if your vessel can sail at the beginning of May or if mid-June would be preferable.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Our vessel, a fully containerized ship, has a sailing speed of 11-12 knots and a capacity of 5,000MT. Currently, it operates at 60% capacity. It is scheduled to arrive in Hong Kong on June 1st and in Sri Lanka on June 9th, early morning.

Please let me know if you are interested, and I can provide further details.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo
email_chain.body:
Simon,

Thank you for the information. My thoughts align with the solution you provided. I appreciate your assistance.

Sincere regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo
email_chain.body:
Mike,

To proceed, I need the following details as soon as possible:
1. The name of the vessel scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka in mid-June.
2. The approximate arrival time in Sri Lanka.
3. Whether you need additional port details or other essential information about the vessel.

Your reply will help me provide suitable solutions.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo
email_chain.body:
Mike,

I understand your urgency to transport 4,000MT to Sri Lanka as soon as possible. However, the details provided are insufficient for me to make a decision. Time is critical, and I cannot wait longer than 48 hours.

You are seeking a fully containerized vessel to arrive quickly and are willing to pay a premium for it. Please clarify your requirements so I can assist further.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for 4,000MT Cargo
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Thank you for your message. It seems there is some misunderstanding. I have been asking for the vessel's name, arrival time, and capacity details to transport 4,000MT. Please clarify the following:
1. The name of the vessel arriving in Sri Lanka in mid-June.
2. The approximate arrival time.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mrs. Blake,

We’re looking at 3,000MT of tin ore from Mousa, Cyprus to Istanbul. Could you confirm your demurrage rate, and do you anticipate any weekend berth restrictions?

Sincerely,
Rose

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Rose,

I’m here on weekends. Will let you know about the demurrage rate and weekend berth restrictions.

Yours,
Tushar

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Tushar,

Thank you for your confirmation. We can proceed with this shipment under your terms. Could you please send the details of demurrage charges?

Regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Helen,

Our terms are T/C at 100% L/C. Please let me know the details of your requirements regarding demurrage.

Regards,
Tushar

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Tushar,

Thanks for your details. Regarding demurrage, it’s better that we keep it flexible for now. What if I send you a request for L/C?

Regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Helen,

Thanks for your reply. Let me know the details of your requirements.

Regards,
Tushar

email_chain.subject: RE: Tin Ore Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Tushar,

I have a requirement of T/C at 100% L/C. Could you provide further details on the demurrage charges?

Regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability and Security Charges Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Adams,

Please confirm if your vessel will be able to pick up 10,000 tons of seagoing liquids from Aruba and transport them to Panama. Additionally, could you advise if there are any expected extra security charges at Aruba?

Sincerely,
John

email_chain.subject: Rescheduling Call at Aruba
email_chain.body:
Mr. Adams,

I would like to reschedule our planned call at Aruba. I am currently waiting to hear back from management on a request for proposal. I have secured a new vessel that could call at Aruba within a week.

Could you please check availability and see if it is feasible to call at Aruba on the 22nd?

Thank you,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Request for Security Inspection and Dry Dock Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Mr. Adams,

Could you please arrange for an on-site security officer to conduct a random vessel inspection at my request?

Also, could you arrange for a 2nd dry dock in Panama, as I have already used the first slot?

Kind regards,
Fred

email_chain.subject: Cruise Booking Confirmation and Questionnaire
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

You have booked a cruise from Canada to New Zealand for the month of July 2010, which is rather special. Can you please fill out this questionnaire and let me know if you have any special requests?

Many thanks,
Melinda

email_chain.subject: Cruise Itinerary and Booking Form
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

I have attached the cruise itinerary, along with the form and other relevant information. Please let me know if you have any special requests, otherwise you can just sign and return the attached form.

It will be my pleasure to attend to your needs,
Melinda

Cruise Itinerary:

Dear Mr. Kelly,
