email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Leading Inland Point for Coal
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jackson,

Could you let me know what is the leading inland point for coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam in July?

I hope to speak with you soon.

Best regards,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Leading Inland Point for Coal
email_chain.body:
Dear Melissa,

There are a variety of ways to get coal to Rotterdam:

The first is rail from Felixstowe to The Hook where it is loaded onto barges.
The second is by sea.

However, the leading inland point for coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam in July is via rail.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Leading Inland Point for Coal
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for taking the time to write to me. I appreciate the information and look forward to working with you in the future.

Best regards,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Leading Inland Point for Coal
email_chain.body:
Dear Melissa,

It was a pleasure speaking with you. Feel free to call me anytime.

Best,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Thank You
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

I hope all is well. Just a quick note to say thank you for the informational email I received. It was very helpful.

Thank you for your time.

Best,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Vessel Equinox Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bensoussan,

Can you confirm if your vessel Equinox is in Aqaba or not?

Looking forward to working with you.

Best regards,
Hari

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Equinox Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Greetings Hari,

Thank you for your contact. In terms of the availability of the vessel Equinox, we have the following plans:
- The ship is not available between October 10 - December 15, 2019.
- The ship is available for employment starting from December 15, 2019.

The general cargo capacity of the vessel is 8800 dwt.

Please advise if you are interested.

We are looking forward to working with you.

Best regards,
Captain Bensoussan

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Equinox Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Bensoussan,

Thank you for the time and availability details. Please confirm how we can proceed, as you are the only one we are considering for this charter.

Looking forward to your response.

email_chain.subject: Marketing Opportunities and Summer Sale Promotion
email_chain.body:
I think it would be very helpful to add:
1. Open houses or webinars that are available.
2. Written guides to FESCO's various operations.
3. Other marketing opportunities that the company has.

You might consider:
The European Summer Sale with 60% off the list rates for all containers booked by July 20th, 2019. In addition, all European shipments booked before September 1st will receive an additional discount of 25%. Contact your account manager to learn more about this promotion.

If you're looking for summer destinations, we also have low rates to Portugal. For more information, please contact me.

Sincerely,
Diane

email_chain.subject: Re: Marketing Opportunities and Summer Sale Promotion
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the information on the special rate. I will add that to my projects. I do have a question about the promotion for rail and ocean. Can you provide more details? Is this only for Europe to North America? Also, can you tell me the details of the rail promotion? Is this for all rail or for certain rail lines? Thanks.

Sandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Rail and Ocean Promotion Details
email_chain.body:
You asked about the rail promotion. This promotion applies to any rail mode in any direction. It only applies to shippers who book before July 20th. Here is a sample of the promotion that can be added to an email or web banner. This sample promotion applies to east coast shippers only, but it is up to you what direction you want to promote.

Sorry, you cannot apply this special rate to shipments within North America. Special ocean promotions for service to the U.S. East Coast.

email_chain.subject: Re: U.S. East Coast and West Coast Ports
email_chain.body: In the United States, what you consider the east coast is a very large area. It includes New York, Philadelphia, Boston, Baltimore, Wilmington, Richmond, Norfolk, Charleston, Savannah, Jacksonville, Miami, New Orleans, Houston, Galveston, Mobile, and New York City. Special ocean promotions for service to the U.S. West Coast. It is great to hear that you are including different areas in your marketing. We also have promotion available to several ports on the west coast including the following ports: Los Angeles, Long Beach, Tacoma, Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, Oakland, Richmond, and Wilmington. We also have ports in the Gulf of Mexico that you may want to consider adding such as: Mobile, Gulfport, New Orleans, and Houston. I will add the link below so you can see all of our locations. http://www.silverferries.com/lotes

email_chain.subject: Re: Rail and Ocean Promotion Details
email_chain.body:
I have added the rail promotion to the bottom of my emails. I will review the list of ports in the Gulf Coast area and add that to my email for customers in that area. Please let me know if there is anything else I can do for you. Thanks.

Sandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Site Visit Arrangements
email_chain.body: I will contact you shortly to make arrangements for the site visit.

email_chain.subject: Re: Summer Sale Promotion
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the information on the summer sale. I have included this in my email to customers.

I'm not sure what you mean by 'Low rates to Portugal'. If you are referring to lower transportation rates for the summer months, then this promotion is only for shipments booked by July 20th, 2019. For more information on this promotion, please contact your account manager.

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Chan,

Could you please calculate a freight estimate for 5,800MT of imported corrugated cardboard from Atlanta to Singapore under FOB terms?

I would also be interested in seeing a sea rate for 5,400MT of fructose syrup from Baton Rouge to Antwerp on a vessel departing Antwerp in October.

Regards,
Joseph

email_chain.subject: Freight Cost Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Chan,

How much does it cost to transport 6,000MT of lumber from Melbourne to Darwin?

Sincerely,
Bill

email_chain.subject: Summary of Freight Requests
email_chain.body:
Dear Esther,

From Joseph's email, I can identify that he needs to calculate the FOB Atlanta to Singapore import freight and also see the sea rate for 5,400MT of fructose syrup from Baton Rouge to Antwerp on a vessel departing Antwerp in October. From Bill's email, I can identify that he needs to calculate the FOB Melbourne to Darwin freight rate.

This is an excellent way to summarize the requirements. Do you have any other requirements that you'd like to share with us?

Thanks,
Jasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Summary of Freight Requests
email_chain.body:
Dear Jasmine,

Thank you so much for your email. I believe that the summary of the requirements is correct. Do let me know if you'd like to clarify anything, please.

Thanks again.
Esther

email_chain.subject: Udemy Course Inquiry
email_chain.body:

How can I check if a course I registered with Udemy 6 months ago is still valid? It says they are affiliated with Harvard University, but when I searched, it could not be found, and the status is 'Inactive.' I am a little concerned that it could have expired since I had this course earlier. Thanks.

email_chain.subject: Re: Udemy Course Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Esther,

Could you please check if the course has been updated? You may want to try accessing the content again.

Best,
Jasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Udemy Course Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jasmine,

I have successfully accessed the content. Thank you!

Kind Regards,
Esther

email_chain.subject: Re: Questions Regarding Coffee Beans

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for 3,000MT from Antwerp to Alexandria
email_chain.body:
Hi Chantal,

We are planning to ship 3,000MT of containers from Antwerp to Alexandria, Egypt. Could you please provide the necessary details and confirm the CFR (Cost and Freight) rate for this shipment?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Sender

email_chain.subject: Re: CFW-CBZ OOG Rate
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for your email. We have received your inquiry and would like to confirm the rate for shipping packed items to Alexandria, Egypt. Specifically, we are looking to ship refrigerators with the following specifications:

- Refrigerator Specifications:
  - Power: 250 Volt, 50 Hz
  - Dimensions: 1.5m x 1.5m x 2.5m
  - Quantity: 40 units
  - Total Volume: 40 CBM
  - Loading: 3 units per 20-foot container

Please confirm the rate for a single container load to Alexandria Port.

Best regards,
Chantal

email_chain.subject: Re: CFW-CBZ OOG Rate
email_chain.body:
Dear Chantal,

Thank you for your prompt response. I can confirm that we are able to ship all the refrigerators in one container. However, please note that the refrigerators will require some disassembly to fit within the container, which may require additional space. Could you please provide an updated rate considering this requirement?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Sender

email_chain.subject: Request for Lumpsum Offer for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mrs. Oliver,

Mehdi

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Lumpsum Offer for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mehdi,

Please allow me to offer you a base price of USD 500/MT for 9,000MT. Our rice import prices range from USD 480 to USD 520/MT, and the C&F price will be USD 520/MT. A shipment by November would be required. Please confirm your acceptance and kindly send me your firm cargo availability details.

Kind regards,
Mrs. Oliver

email_chain.subject: Charter Offer for 10.5 Days at Port in Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

I'm happy to provide you with a charter offer for 10.5 days at port in Busan. Please refer to the attached schedule.

A window of opportunity is now open, and the 10.5-day charter may be secured with an ETA at the port in Hong Kong on May 3rd. Six units of 1,750m3 each are available for delivery, and the charter cost for 3 weeks is USD 8,400,000.

Sincerely,
Davin

email_chain.subject: Offer for 1 x 1,750m3 Charter
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Luca,

Based on the schedule in Attachment 1, please accept our offer of 1 x 1,750m3 at a rate of USD 1,800.00 per cubic meter per day. This constitutes a total of USD 3,650,000.00 per day. Please acknowledge receipt of this offer with an answer no later than 4.5 hours from the time of receipt of this email.

Regards,
Fabio

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Ms. Lin,

We’re arranging 20,000MT of sugar from Kobe to Ma’anshan. We have space available on the Ricka Maru on 15 May. Could you inform us if the vessel is available for your cargo?

Yours truly,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

I’ve been trying to reach you to find out about the vessel Ricka Maru. We have space available on this vessel and will be leaving port on 19 April. If you could confirm availability, then I can place our order.

Thank you,
Jona

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Jona,

Thanks for your message. We are currently short of space, but we are expecting 40,000MT of sugar from Vietnam to Kobe soon. That will clear up some of our space requirements.

Best regards,
Scotty

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Scotty,

Thank you for the good news. As you know, our customer’s expectations are high and tight schedules are required. We will therefore need to start taking bookings again as soon as possible. We will require 10,000MT of sugar from Kobe to Tianjin port in China within the next 15 days. Our firm is prepared to pay a premium for immediate availability.

Please let us know if the Ricka Maru is available.

Best regards,
Sean

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sean,

Unfortunately, I’m afraid the Ricka Maru isn’t available for your cargo at the moment. I am able to offer you a few other vessels for consideration, but I’m afraid that will mean delaying your delivery schedule by a couple of days. I will therefore send you a list of the vessels I have available along with the estimated delivery schedules.

Thank you,
Scotty

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sean,

Thanks for your message. The Ricka Maru is on the schedule now. As for delivery schedules, there are no changes in our fleet’s current schedule.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of Offer

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Transport
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martinez,

We need to charter a vessel from Tangier to Halifax. Please find below our cargo requirements: 20,000MT of iron ore. Our preferred loading port is Bremerhaven, and we would need to pick up another 15,000MT in Lagos before sailing to Halifax.

Could you please provide your best price and the lead time to loading?

Thanks,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Alex,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the transportation of iron ore from Bremerhaven to Lagos and Halifax. We are pleased to assist you with your logistics requirements.

Our current lead time to loading is approximately 10 to 12 weeks. The rate for the 20,000MT from Bremerhaven is <$4.00> USD per metric ton, and the additional 15,000MT in Lagos will incur an extra <$1.00> USD per metric ton. We are open to discussing adjustments to align with your budget.

Please let us know if you have any further questions or if you would like to proceed.

Best regards,
Mr. Martinez

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Martinez,

Thank you for your quote. I am considering placing the charter order for the MV Unknown, but I have a few concerns:

1. The floating rate seems higher than expected. Could you provide the current floating rate in USD and the cost of living in Lagos?
2. The lead time to loading is longer than my project timeline allows. Is there any way to expedite this?

I need these details resolved before I can proceed.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Martinez,

To clarify, the 20,000MT of iron ore will be loaded on the MV Unknown in Bremerhaven, and the additional 15,000MT will be picked up in Lagos. Your firm is the only one that provided an exact lead time to loading, which I appreciate.

However, the floating rate appears high compared to the $1.50 per metric ton rate in London. Could you adjust this to align with market rates?

I would like to approve the chartering of the MV Unknown by next week. Please provide your revised rate.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Transport - Contract Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Alex,

Attached are the details of our previous discussions and the proposed contract for the transportation of your cargo. If you have any questions or wish to make amendments, please contact us promptly.

Also attached are the general conditions of our cooperation, including payment terms. We recommend payment to our European bank account as outlined in the attached General Conditions 9-11.

Please review, fill in any necessary details, and return the contract for final approval.

Best regards,
Mr. Martinez

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote - Palm Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zhang,

I’ve confirmed 7,000MT of palm oil from Antwerp to Shanghai. Could you provide us with a quick quote? Do you foresee any port draft limitations?

Kind regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - Palm Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Charles,

Yes, it’s confirmed! I’d recommend choosing Neptun (NEO3), which is a hybrid vessel with very low port draft. There’s no draft limitation for NEO3 when discharging in the deepwater port.

Best regards,
Tiffany

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - Palm Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - Palm Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Charles,

If you can afford to spend time in the port, we’d recommend leaving the vessel out for 4 days in Nanjing (Nanj). This will allow the vessel to reach maximum draft in Nanjing and improve its discharge efficiency. Since Nanjing has less costs on one side (manpower and cargo handling) and Shanghai on the other (draft and terminal fees), we’d recommend you to start the discharging from Nanjing.

Best regards,
Tiffany

email_chain.subject: Discussion on Kolhe Industrial Deal
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Gates,

On my flight out of Moscow this morning, I was approached by a former Kolhe industrial sales rep. He assured me that you would never consider giving Kolhe a deal like the one they are offering me. He suggested that if I mentioned this conversation to the right people, my activities would be viewed very favorably.

Would you mind discussing this matter with me and letting me know whether you think he is correct?

Best regards,
Sean

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Your Request for a Meeting
email_chain.body:
This is to follow up on your letter of the 27th, requesting a meeting.

Kolhe would like to offer you a very low price for the new wave of ignition tubes we will have available in March. The current bid that Kolhe has for this particular area is for 1 million kits at $200 each. Kolhe is very willing to cut a deal in which you will get the tubes for $100 per kit if you put the order in now, and will pay 1 million for 500 thousand more kits when you are ready to place the final order. You will also need to commit to providing us with ten million more tubes a year, each one for $200.

This plan will ensure that Kolhe has a dependable source of income until we can start producing the tubes ourselves. It will give you time to both double your income as well as cut your costs.

email_chain.subject: Re: Anonymous Letter
email_chain.body:
Dear Sean,

Received as follows:

This letter shall be void if not received by 15 September 2001. The contents of this letter must not be divulged to third parties.

I am a patient of the State Department of Public Health in New York. Recently, a court order was granted for my records to be confiscated. I have appealed this action and am fighting this order.

I have forwarded copies of this letter to the Office of the Inspector General and would request your assistance in this matter. I would like to request the following:

- Your assistance in this matter.
- To let the Inspector General and the State Department of Public Health know that the 15-day deadline is unconstitutional and unethical.
- The records you confiscated are being held at the State Department of Public Health.

Any copies of those records should be returned to me immediately.

Best regards,
Mr. Gates

email_chain.subject: Re: Anonymous Letter
email_chain.body:
Hello Mike,

Your letter arrived today, and I apologize for the delay in my reply. To be honest, I have put your question on the backburner for a couple of days and have since forgotten about it. I cannot tell you whether or not I am truly at 100% capacity, because it has been nearly twenty years since I have had a serious medical examination. I do know that I have been drinking constantly for almost the past year, which has caused my heart rate to accelerate to over 120 BPM (about 85 for a healthy individual).

Best regards,
Mr. Gates

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Shipping Ginger Essential Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Shan,

We are planning to ship 33,000 liters of ginger essential oil from San Francisco to Taipei in 12” drums. Since it is a perishable product, we are hoping to use your refrigerated containers. Could you confirm if this is possible?

Kind regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Shipping Ginger Essential Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Kate,

Thank you for your email. We are delighted to assist you with your shipment. For temperature-sensitive products like ginger essential oil, we recommend using ISO refrigerated containers. These containers are specially designed to maintain the required temperature throughout the journey.

We have extensive experience in shipping perishable goods. For instance, we have successfully shipped over 80,000 cartons of liquid chocolate spread for a major UK chocolate manufacturer and 11,000 cans of spray paint from Belgium to the UK.

We can provide a full ISO container for your shipment, ensuring your ginger essential oil arrives in perfect condition. We can arrange to pick up the container from your warehouse and deliver it to your preferred port in San Francisco.

Please let us know if you have any further questions or need additional information.

Kind regards,
Mr. Shan

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Dry Ice Shipment Cost
email_chain.body:
Hello,

I was wondering how much it would cost to ship a dry ice shipment from Chicago to Hong Kong. Would a 20ft container be sufficient for this?

Kind regards,
Stacy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Dry Ice Shipment Cost
email_chain.body:
Dear Stacy,

Thank you for your inquiry. A dry ice shipment would indeed require a refrigerated ISO container. These containers are ideal for maintaining low temperatures, making them perfect for shipping temperature-sensitive goods like dry ice.

We have experience shipping similar products, such as 10,000 cans of spray paint and 6,500 liters of flour from the UK to Denmark, using ISO containers. The airtight seal of these containers ensures that the dry ice remains effective throughout the journey.

Please let us know the exact volume and weight of your shipment so we can provide a precise quote. A 20ft container might be suitable, but we can confirm once we have more details.

Kind regards,
Mr. Shan

email_chain.subject: Report on FOB Shipments
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

We were recently contacted by one of your old customers regarding their past experiences with FOB shipments. We have prepared a short report and have attached it here. Feel free to take a look.

In case you require any other information, please let me know.

Warmest regards,
Anja

email_chain.subject: Re: Report on FOB Shipments
email_chain.body:
Hi Anja,

I have reviewed your email dated December 2, 2019, and would like to clarify. We were never contacted by one of your old customers regarding our past experiences with FOB shipments. As such, I do not understand how we were ever in receipt of a short report and an attachment of the same.

While we will always value the opportunity to assist in any way we can, I do not feel that this is an appropriate way to present a point of view, particularly without providing any facts to support your position.

I am happy to say that we do not stand on the side of FOB shipments. We have always insisted that cargo arrives fully insured, regardless of shipping method, and all cargo is insured for its full value when leaving the warehouse.

We also appreciate the opportunity to present our point of view. We would like to take this opportunity to ask that you provide us the opportunity to clarify our stance further.

Best regards,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Meeting Availability
email_chain.body: When will you be available for a meeting?

email_chain.subject: Re: Meeting Availability
email_chain.body: Due to the complexity of these tests, they need to be run in the laboratory. Preparing a lab experiment for this type of request may take several hours. Sometimes the lab will need to send a sample to a third-party lab to be tested, which will need to take several days to perform the test. This type of request is needed to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the final results. During the ‘test’ phase, we will keep you updated on the progress.

email_chain.subject: Order Processing Update
email_chain.body: I went through your email and it is correct to process the order as you mentioned. Since I received this information, I have sent the email to the department heads to inform them of the status of the order.

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Processing Update
email_chain.body: I received your email today. I was able to look into this situation, and the sample was analyzed last Friday. I understand that the quality of the batch is the reason why this is not approved, and it will not be approved until the supplier does some corrective actions. Unfortunately, this cannot be done overnight. I am expecting that the supplier will do some corrective actions within a week, and then we can submit another request to the QCP for approval. The key is that the corrective actions are actually implemented in the system and the results are visible to us. Note: A specific deadline for the implementation of the corrective actions should be communicated to the supplier by the supplier's contract manager.

email_chain.subject: Quality Review Findings
email_chain.body: A couple of my colleagues and I have just finished a quality review of the product that is produced by the supplier. The results were that the company has had problems with this product since they started. When we looked into the history, we could see that all the products that were produced were defective. As you know, this is not allowed according to the standards we work with. The reason for this is that the supplier does not have any documented process controls for the production process. We were told by the supplier that they have been working on this for a long time but they have not been able to solve it. Note: I know that you will have a lot of questions. You should not feel uncomfortable asking questions, and if you need to get any information from our side, please do so. I know that this is not a perfect situation, but I think we should work together to solve this problem.

Hi Arjun,

I need a comprehensive spreadsheet with prices for various power and industrial projects, with the cost breakdown, including materials and labor. For this, I’ll need a completely separate sheet for each project, because we’re working with many different projects and we need to keep track of each one.

Our last few projects with this company were a mess because they kept combining the different materials and labor costs with each other. That’s how they ended up with completely overinflated estimates. It’s a mess, and I don’t want that again. The prices should be straightforward. I don’t need an estimate for every part of the project, only the overall cost of the entire project.

Best,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Decision to Switch Electrical Company
email_chain.body:
Hi Arjun,

I really like your project work, but the prices for the last two projects were not satisfactory. So, I’ve decided to switch the electrical company and work with… argh, it’s a shock, but it’s the right decision to make. I have no need for you to get mad, just get back to us.

Best,
Vladi
(Signature: Vladimir)

email_chain.subject: Apology and Explanation
email_chain.body:
Hi Vladimir,

Sorry for the brief response. I apologize for the occasional interruptions and communication issues on my side. Our company, ProjectPlex (that’s us, Arjun), has been growing rapidly and has also faced some personal challenges recently, which made it difficult to keep up.

You may recall a few years ago that I had a dental procedure that was more complicated than I thought, which, unfortunately, caused me to have some extended downtime. At the time, my wife and I were experiencing a financial crunch, and we had to take on some overtime work to keep up. That’s why I was only able to pay you so little over the last few months, and why I’ve been so stressed out lately.

I’ve tried my best to make it up to you, but I understand that I can’t make up for such a long period of time with nothing but work. I’ll try to pay you as much as I can over the next few months, and if I can get things settled soon, I can pay more. Again, I apologize for my behavior, and I hope we can continue our working relationship.

Best,
Arjun
(Signature: Arjun Singh)

Please let me know if you could accept this offer for paraffin wax. I am willing to proceed under FOB terms, and the freight cost would be USD 1700 per TEU. We are ready to deliver your commodities as soon as possible. Please feel free to share any further comments, and I look forward to your response.

We have reviewed the CIF terms offered by your company for API Solvent 70%. Thank you for your time and support regarding our inquiry. Our buyer has finalized the purchase order for 6,000 MTs, to be transported via ocean freight to Colombia under CIF terms. The details are as follows:

- Quantity: 6,000 MTs
- Shipping Port: Whangodeoku
- Destination Port: Colombia
- Packing: Bags of 210 kg (average 2 bags per carton)
- Payment: 50% L/C at sight and 50% L/C against B/L

We will soon release a blanket order to VCI and will send you copies of the blanket order in due course.

Best Regards,
Tommy

We are pleased to inform you that your request has been approved, and our company has finalized the payment and offer terms for the supply contract. The offer terms are as follows:

- Type: Styrene Dimer

- Quantity: 7,000 MTs

Best Regards,

The rate is US$ 6.00 per MT. In addition, you need to pay for other freight charges, such as loading and discharge charges, health certificate, and ocean freight forwarding charges.

Steve Nguyen

email_chain.body:

We’re open for exporting 250 tons of chemicals from Bremen to Dingle, Ireland. Could you let me know your rates with flexibility on arrival date and distance from Norway?

Let me know if you would need any information regarding cargo?

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

I received your request concerning the cargo. It is a 250-ton cargo. On July 7th, I replied to your email asking if I could inform you about prices and arrival dates, but I did not receive a reply from you.

As a solution, I have also sent an email to ask you for information and prices to meet your cargo requirements. My name is David from ABF Forwarding Limited, and I am glad to be of any help to you.

We hope to receive a response from you with the following information: HOU (including loading port), HGD (destination port), HCT (including payment terms), and quantities of the goods.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

The 250 tons of chemicals can be exported from Bremen, Germany. For the ports, you will be the best in informing on that.

I shall look forward to receiving a confirmation from you with the above information as soon as possible.

Thank you.

Best regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

Your mail was received and acknowledged. The above cargo is a 250-ton load in total. It would be ideal to load cargo from Berlin. However, if we load cargo from Bremen, then the cargo can be loaded on a vessel sailing to Dublin by the end of November. The goods can be brought to Dublin from Bremen by the end of October 2016.

In case you need the price for shipping cargo from Bremen, we are ready to provide it to you.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body:

No, I don’t need the prices for shipping cargo from Bremen. Thanks.

Best regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo, dates and info
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

However, if we load cargo from Bremen, then the cargo can be loaded on a vessel sailing to Dublin by the end of November. The goods can be brought to Dublin from Bremen by the end of October 2016.

In case you need the price for shipping cargo from Bremen, we are ready to provide it to you.

Thanks.

Best regards,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Alcohol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello James,

I am looking to arrange a shipment of 250 metric tonnes of Alcohol from Tanjung Kelang (PJ) to Benin (CI). Could you provide an indication of the freight costs? Additionally, is laytime negotiable beyond 45 days?

Regards,
Jean

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Alcohol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jean,

Thank you for your recent inquiry regarding the shipment of 250 metric tonnes of Alcohol from Benin to Singapore. Following our discussions, I am pleased to provide you with a quote for your consideration. Below are the details noted from your inquiry:

- From: Benin to Singapore (DP)
- Loading Port: Cotonou
- Cargo Details: 250 tonnes of Alcohol
- Delivery Instructions: Container packed and ready at loading port. The client has agreed to pay all applicable terminal fees. The cargo is required to be placed on 24 hours notice, with delivery within 1 week of loading.

Tare: 7.5 tonnes
Net Gross Weight: 95.0 - 7.5

Note: Lay time is negotiable for both sides; Delivery in Singapore.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Alcohol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jean,

In reference to our previous communication, I would like to confirm the following quote provided to you:

- Carrier Cost: $6,600
- Insurance: $850
- Terminal Handling: $800
- Total: $7,250

This rate is applicable for the shipment of Alcohol from Benin to Singapore, with the loading port at Cotonou, and a shipping date of 05/12/05. The container includes all transport insurance, inclusive of war and strike.

Should you require any further assistance or additional details, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Thank you,
James

email_chain.subject: Seawater Hose Requirement for Vessel Urania
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Lin,

We will be sending 100MT of granules for your vessel Urania. Please advise us if you will be needing a seawater hose on the ballast.

Best regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Seawater Hose Requirement for Vessel Urania
email_chain.body:
Hello Anthony,

Thank you for your email. As for your proposal, the UCRATIS team has decided to take action in a different direction. To be more specific, we think that at this time, the communication of the tanker Urania to the local authorities is enough to ensure environmental safety. We are willing to share our communication with the nearby towns on this local website: https://www.comportadecreciente.com/comporta.html.

As for the lagoons, the port authority will keep doing their inspections and reporting to the correct authorities. That is not under our scope. If you could kindly refer to the annex, you could find relevant information on what the port authority has to do.

The final assessment of the damages and liability will be the jurisdiction of a tribunal, not the team from the UCRATIS.

Best regards,
Mr. Lin

email_chain.subject: Request to Ground Vessel Urania in Escombreras Bay
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

The owner and charterer of the ship Urania have decided to take immediate action and ground the vessel in Escombreras Bay due to the alarm generated by the cargo spill of illegal poaching activities and, more recently, the news of the vessel leaving Malaga port for 8 hours without proper documentation. We would like to ask you to make an agreement to enable us to ground the vessel in Escombreras Bay, in compliance with our charter agreement, which, according to our lawyers, is a non-arbitral agreement. Please let us know how long it will take you to authorize our operation.

Best regards,
Jonathan Hagan

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Dry Bulk Cargo of 9,500MT Limestone
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Brandon,

I am considering your company for the shipment of 9,500MT of limestone from South Africa to Indonesia. Could you please confirm your available space and whether you can offer a fixed rate or ship at cost+3% to P&I?

Thank you,
Sam

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry for Dry Bulk Cargo of 9,500MT Limestone
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thank you for your inquiry. We do have availability for your proposed voyage. Currently, we are offering the space at 19% above our spot rate. I understand you are interested in a fixed rate, and we will consider this when issuing an offer. Please note that spot rates for this commodity are quite high at the moment. If you wish to proceed, our offer will be valid for 48 hours. Kindly confirm receipt of this proposal.

Thanks,
Nicolas

email_chain.subject: RE: Proposal for Dry Bulk Cargo of 9,500MT Limestone
email_chain.body:
Hi Nicolas and Brandon,

Thank you for your proposal. I have received it and am considering the details. I am particularly interested in the fixed rate option. Could you provide more specifics on this?

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: RE: Fixed Rate Offer for Dry Bulk Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam and Brandon,

Following up on our previous discussions, I have calculated the total cost of shipment and can offer a fixed rate for the entire trip. The quotation will be 27% above the spot rate. I understand this may seem high, but it reflects current market conditions. Please let me know if this rate suits your requirements.

Thanks,
Nicolas

email_chain.subject: Final Proposal for Dry Bulk Cargo of 9,500MT Limestone
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam and Brandon,

I am sending the final proposal. I have offered a fixed rate of $16,125 per metric ton. Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Thanks,
Nicolas

email_chain.subject: RE: Acceptance of Final Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hi Nicolas,

We have reviewed your final proposal and are pleased to accept the offer of $16,125 per metric ton. Please confirm the space and provide the estimated time of loading, departure, and arrival.

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: RE: Confirmation of Loading and Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam and Brandon,

Thank you for accepting our proposal. I have confirmed your acceptance, and we are now proceeding with the loading, departure, and arrival schedules. Our vessel is currently discharging at the port of Durban, South Africa, and we will be loading the limestone on board on the 18th of October. We expect to reach the Indonesian port of Tanjung Priok on the 30th of October.

Thanks,
Nicolas

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 2,000MT Chemical Shipment from Kavala to Odessa
email_chain.body:
Good day Ms. Spivakova,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the 2,000MT chemical shipment from Kavala to Odessa. To proceed, I need to know your margin for margin calculation purposes. Additionally, could you provide a quote for groupage charges?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 2,000MT Chemical Shipment from Kavala to Odessa
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message.

I have calculated the possible shipping costs as follows:
- Full Container Load (FCL): 400 EUR
- Groupage (24 MT): 210 EUR

Based on my margin calculation, FCL shipping appears to be the most cost-effective option. Please let me know if I am missing any details or if there are additional factors to consider.

Best regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 2,000MT Chemical Shipment from Kavala to Odessa
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email.

I have calculated the margin based on a full container load, and the margin for the Kavala to Odessa route is:
0.4 * 120,000 / 12 = 2,000 USD.

We should be able to offer a surcharge of 400 EUR for any container size, not just a 20ft one. Please review the calculations and advise if anything needs adjustment.

Best regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 2,000MT Chemical Shipment from Kavala to Odessa
email_chain.body:
Dear Maria,

The margin from the survey is 36%, not 12%. Could you please confirm this and adjust the calculations accordingly?

Best regards,
Jonas

Best regards,
Nate

email_chain.subject: Full Ship Inquiry for April

Margot

email_chain.subject: Cabin for Six Inquiry
email_chain.body:

Thanks,
Hildy

email_chain.body:

Thank you,

email_chain.body:

We’re planning a wedding anniversary cruise in July and would like to have a party onboard. Is it possible for you to help us out? If so, what’s the price for your best champagne on the ship?

Thanks,
Jeff

email_chain.subject: Re: Full Ship Inquiry for April
email_chain.body:
Dear Margot,

I’m afraid the earliest we could take a ship out would be next November. We only have one ship, and it’s always fully booked.

Best regards,
Hilary Price

email_chain.subject: Re: Cabin for Six Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Hildy,

We could charter an entire ship for you, but it’s very expensive. Let me check with the travel agents for details. You could probably get a quote next week.

Best regards,
Hilary Price

email_chain.subject: Re: Wedding Anniversary Cruise Inquiry
email_chain.body:

You could charter the entire ship for your anniversary party, but we can’t begin planning your trip until I have a confirmed date. Have you been on a cruise before?

Best regards,
Hilary Price

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:

Thank you for getting back to us regarding MS Irene. We are interested in shipping your coal and are looking for the earliest possible loading window. Could you please let us know your best offer?

The charter rate is $33,000/day and the owner’s hire is $4,500/day.

Best regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Cargo Loading and Charter Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Gomes,

Kind regards to you and all your staff. How are you all doing? We are currently loading cargo for IMO 2020, and hopefully, the charter will start in 20 days with your ship. We are loading about 300k tons with 1.5% MGO, and of course, you will carry FSO. We are sailing C2C and will add a 500k MT of GHT on each way.

I have asked for your arrival notice, so it should be there soon. In that case, we would like to ask you to call me to discuss the delivery of the cargo to your yard.

I would also like to get in touch with you on a more formal basis. I would be interested in getting your charter partner, manager, or someone with a similar profile. I would appreciate it if you could arrange this.

Best regards,
Lars Petter Berge

Please let me know if you can.

Alex

email_chain.body:

Thank you for your offer. Unfortunately, we will not be able to send the cargo to Rotterdam by ship. We plan to send our shipment to Dublin, Ireland, via the Rotterdam-Rotterdam route. This is why we will be chartering a vessel.

Sharon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Availability and Charges
email_chain.body:

Great to hear from you. Please let me know when you will need to complete your paperwork. We are available from Monday, 21 August to Friday, 25 August.

We are 1 to 2 days ahead of schedule this week, and it should take us at most 2 weeks to load.

Best,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Coal Import Inquiry - Adrian
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Neko,

We’re planning to import a 6,600MT cargo of coal from Richards Bay to Maputo next week. Do you have an open slot available?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Wood Import Inquiry - Cachorrão
email_chain.body:
Olá Cachorrão,

Há 6 anos, estou começando a importar madeira até o Sul da África. A troca tem sido espetacular. Antes, os canadenses e australianos dominavam o mercado. Agora, a quantidade de produto das florestas do Brasil começou a 'explosão'.

No entanto, agora enfrentamos dificuldades de transporte. Rio de Janeiro é quase a metade da distância entre Salvador e Maputo. E o canal do Panamá no momento está parado devido à chuva. Você tem um lugar aberto agora para importar da BRASIL até a S.AFRICA?

Se tiver espaço, veja o preço de uma nota de.

Atenciosamente,
Cachorrão

email_chain.subject: Re: Wood Import Inquiry - Cachorrão
email_chain.body:
Muito obrigado por sua mensagem de véspera.

Eu estou mais que contente de saber que você está mexendo com madeira! Eu levo só grãos e barcos com meus amigos de ZIMBABWE e Ruanda. Não temos problemas transportando grãos desde que as canais no Oceano Atlântico estão abertos.

Nós entramos para fazer um pequeno caminho em Zimbabve e temos uma abertura única em Ruanda. Eu queria fazer o caminho todo para a S.AFRICA mas tenho a desconfiança do canal do Panamá. A situação parece muito ruim no canal em 2019/2020.

Nós pudemos cruzar o Atlântico com segurança. Eu tenho um tripulante de.

Atenciosamente,
Neko

email_chain.subject: Fertilizer Import Update - Moza
email_chain.body:
Meu amigo!

I’m from Mozambique. In the past, I bought bulk grains to Angola from Zambia. But today, I am not selling bulk grains anymore. Today I only sell dry bulk fertilizer, hard fertilizers, soft fertilizers, and rocks.

I also bought 4×4 vehicles, Mercedes Benz and Toyota Landcruiser for private import. I now import grains from the USA, Canada, Australia, South Africa, and West Africa. Today we bring over a million MTs of fertilizers. I just delivered 2,000MT of potassium chloride fertilizer and 50,000MT of Nitrogen fertilizer.

NUFertilizer is a soft fertilizer. We have ready stocks of 500,000MT in storage. Usually, we ship weekly. But this week we are running low on stocks.

Best,
Moza

email_chain.subject: Spices and Goods Import Inquiry - Hungry
email_chain.body:
Hello Neko,

I'm interested in importing spices, fruits, meat, dry goods, hard goods, or cashew nuts. Where can I get an account from you in this area? Can I get a barge berth in this country?

Best,
Hungry

email_chain.subject: Trade Routes Research Inquiry - Researcher
email_chain.body:
Hey Neko!

I am doing research about trade routes and wanted to ask a few questions about your country. I'm especially interested in dry goods and soft goods in particular. I have a particular interest in coal, dried goods, and soft goods.

Please email me at researcher@example.com.

Best,
Researcher

email_chain.subject: Thank You and Update on Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Davis,

We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for the excellent job you have been doing with our shipping services. Over the past year, we have seen significant improvements in your processes, efficiency, and accuracy, and for this, we are very grateful.

As you know, at [Shipper's Name], it is our priority to provide safe, efficient, and reliable transportation, and we know you hold the same values. For this reason, we wanted to inform you that we have started working with another carrier. They are offering cheaper rates, but you have already shown us that you are a company we can trust. If you find that your costs are higher, please let us know.

Although we are shifting to a different provider, we will always remain committed to your business and will be happy to help you in any way we can. Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to assist you.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: Job Opportunity at [Shipper's Name]
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Davis,

We hope you are doing well. Our company is interested in hiring you for a [Position] role, and it would be great to hear from you. We are happy to have your resume on file. In the meantime, we have other similar positions available. As you can see in the attached document, they offer comparable benefits and a great environment to work in. Please feel free to apply.

We would be happy to answer any questions you may have and hope to talk with you soon.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: New Position Available
email_chain.body:
Hi there!

Just wanted to let you know about a new position we have open. Please see the attached flyer for more information. If you are interested in this position, please let us know. If you aren't the right person for this role, we would still love to hear from you.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

email_chain.body:
Hello there!

To learn more about the job and apply for it, please click on the link here: [Link]. We'd love to hear from you.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: New Position Available
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Inquiry for Copper Cathode Shipment
email_chain.body:

Thank you,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Quotation for Copper Cathode Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Alex,

Thank you for your request. I can offer the below FOB quotation to Rotterdam Port:

- Port: Guangzhou to Rotterdam
- Transit Time: 12 days
- Volume: 6 MT
- Rate Quotation: USD 2611/MT FOB Rotterdam

Please kindly check if this price fits your requirement. Note that the customer needs to pay all handling costs at the origin.

Best regards,
Transporter

email_chain.subject: Acceptance of FCA Price and Additional Consignments
email_chain.body:
Dear Transporter,

Thank you for your prompt reply. We will definitely accept your FCA price. We will have two more consignments to Shanghai in about 10-20 days, and we hope that you could assist us with those as well.

Additionally, I am contacting you to learn more about the freight market. Is this the best rate you could offer for a delivery from Suzhou to Rotterdam port? Please contact us, as our goal is not just to find the cheapest solution but the one that offers the best value.

Best regards,
Alex
Telephone: 13396127727

email_chain.subject: Re: Acceptance of FCA Price and Additional Consignments
email_chain.body:
Dear Alex,

Thanks for your message. The port of Rotterdam is indeed a good choice for receiving the cargo. However, we would like to reconfirm if you have also opened up a new forwarder in China. If we do not have any other consignments until next year, perhaps you could send me a revised quotation.

Best regards,
Transporter

email_chain.subject: Request for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Malmo

Would you be able to assist me with 800MT of cement from Vancouver to Malmo next week? Could you advise your best freight estimate, and do you allow weekend loading?

Regards,
Wally

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Malmo
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Wally,

I just received your email, and I apologize for the delay in the cement shipment. This is the first time I have been asked to send cement by air to Sweden. I have contacted my supply chain and am still waiting on the ETA. We have not yet sent the shipment to the forwarder. I am working with my colleagues to expedite this and hope to have more information soon.

Regards,
Mr. Stone

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Malmo
email_chain.body:
Dear Wally,

I wanted to inform you that we have arranged a shipment of 8MT as a sample for you, with the remaining 792MT to follow. We will confirm the date and time for the full shipment shortly.

Regards,
Mr. Stone

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Malmo
email_chain.body:
Dear Wally,

Thank you for your email. We have received your shipment at Malmo, Sweden, on the 5th of September.

Regards,
Johannes

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Gothenburg
email_chain.body:

Kind regards,
Ari

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Gothenburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Ari,

We will send the cement next week, but will let you know the exact dates once we secure a reservation with the cargo airline.

Kind regards,
Mr. Stone

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Cement Shipment from Vancouver to Gothenburg
email_chain.body:
Hi Ari,

You are correct, we can offer you a 2-week delivery from Canada to Sweden. We will arrange your shipment with the cargo airline next week.

Kind regards,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on FREYSSINET Order and Supply Chain Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Gomes,

We recently reviewed your order for FREYSSINET and wanted to check if you are planning any further shipments soon. We specialize in providing efficient supply chain solutions that ensure strict ETA compliance. Our project teams have extensive experience working with organizations of your size and can guarantee timely delivery of your goods.

Sincerely,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on FREYSSINET Order and Supply Chain Proposal
email_chain.body:
James,

Thank you for your email regarding our inventory. I appreciate the time you took to review our order and provide a thoughtful response. Your insights have given me some ideas to consider as we make decisions about our contract.

I must admit, I initially struggled with placing the order without a consultant. I researched FREYSSINET prices and thought I could handle it independently, but your email made me realize there might be more efficient sourcing options available. Perhaps working with an agent or consultant could help us secure better pricing and streamline the process.

Your analysis was impressive, and I look forward to exploring this further.

Best regards,
Gomes

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on FREYSSINET Order and Supply Chain Proposal
email_chain.body:
James,

Thank you for your detailed response. Your email provided valuable information, and I appreciate the effort you put into it. I was particularly intrigued by your suggestion about using an agent or consultant. After some research, I discovered that you utilize consultants for about 10% of your orders, which is encouraging. It seems that working with a consultant or agent could help us save significantly on fees and improve efficiency.

I’d be happy to discuss this further if you’re available. Let me know a convenient time for you.

Sincerely,
Gomes

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Pinto,

Could you please suggest the best way to ship 9,800MT of palm oil from Mataro to Dar es Salaam?

Regards,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

Thanks for your email. We will be happy to get back to you in one business day with our suggestions.

Kind regards,
John Pinto

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

We really appreciate your email. Could you please suggest which method will be the fastest way to get the oil to Dar es Salaam?

Regards,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

First of all, you have made a very good decision picking us as your preferred carrier. We will be very glad to get your cargo to Dar es Salaam. For this, we will be using the 'Fast Liner' shipping method. Please note that the 'Fast Liner' service does not include any delays caused by Customs. If you want to expedite your cargo through customs in Dar es Salaam, please let us know.

Kind regards,
John Pinto

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry for Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Hello Victor,

Thank you for sending your document on the 'Fast Liner' method. Would you mind sending us your credit application to speed up the payment and import clearance process? Please note that this document is very crucial for us to process your cargo.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Haugland,

How’s business? I’m in the market for 4,000 MT of fertilizers from Durban to Farquhar. What’s your best rate?

Regards,
Gunnar

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Sir,

We have a bulk shipment from Durban to our client in New Zealand that is currently sold and docked at Durban. The vessel is due to depart on 20 February and load 5,000 MT of fertilizer at Durban to supply the orders to our client. Can we discuss a price of $35.00 per MT?

Regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Richard,

The vessel is on schedule. We are glad to load your shipment. We can offer a competitive price of $33.50 per MT. We have the product ready in our warehouse. We are offering Fertigo 18-26-0. Do you have any specifications? If not, we can specify any combination. If you need to specify quantities for a particular customer, please inform me. I will get back to you by Monday.

Regards,
Gunnar

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Haugland,

I’m ready to load the shipment on Thursday or Friday. I would like to load 1,500 MT for our first customer, 2,000 MT for our second customer and 2,000 MT for our third customer. Do you have any questions? We can call on Thursday if you prefer. I need to contact the shipping company immediately to get your order on the vessel. It is almost full and we need to space your cargo carefully. I’m ready to discuss any load strategy that you may require. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.

Regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Haugland,

We appreciate your time in responding to our inquiries. We have made a final decision on your offer. We are offering 2,500 MT of Fertigo 18-26-0, which meets our customers requirements. We are still interested in the 4,000 MT load you offered us in our first inquiry, but this time at $33.00 per MT. If you can confirm this, we can proceed immediately. We have to be flexible with the load strategy. It is our first load to Farquhar Island so we have to carefully manage the weight distribution on the vessel to ensure a safe journey. We will not load more than 30% of the cargo on deck. I have sent you an email with our customer details for confirmation purposes.

Regards,
Gunnar

email_chain.subject: Shipping Advice for Jewelry from Mexico to Japan

email_chain.subject: Request to Hold Ethanol Cargo Under DAF
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Yamaguchi,

Our client has just transferred some ethanol to the tank in Riyadh. However, they cannot receive the shipper’s IRB until next week. Could you hold the cargo for 48 hours under DAF for free while waiting for the permit?

Best regards,
Paddy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request to Hold Ethanol Cargo Under DAF
email_chain.body:
Dear Paddy,

The client has just received the IRB from Saudi customs, and the transportation is proceeding to the port. The shipper is waiting for the discharge of the cargo. However, it seems that the port cannot complete the unloading due to a shortage of manpower, as reported by the Saudi agent. The cargo will arrive in Riyadh in 48 hours. Could you keep the cargo in the tank under DAF for 48 hours? I cannot wait any longer for free.

Thanks.

Best regards,
Jon

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Ethanol Transfer
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

I would like to confirm that your client has already transferred some ethanol to the tank in Riyadh. It is likely that the tank was not fully filled due to the shortage of manpower. The cargo was successfully discharged and delivered. I hope to work with you on this opportunity again in the future.

Best regards,
Paddy

email_chain.subject: Request for Laycan Slots and Freight Charges
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Captain Schuppe,

We’re planning to ship 6,000MT of raw material from Rotterdam to Algeciras. Could you please advise on any available laycan slots, as well as any additional freight charges?

Regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Captain Schuppe,

We’ve been receiving bids from the following vessels: Exxpresser, Futura, Goya, Super Valiant, Tyra, and Valspar. Could you please confirm that your vessel is able to load 6,000MT at Rotterdam?

Regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Vessel Arrival and Loading Details
email_chain.body:
Good Afternoon Ryan,

Our vessel, the Exxpresser, will be arriving in Rotterdam in 8 days. She is scheduled to arrive at 1:30 PM Rotterdam time on July 1st. We are looking to offload her cargo in Algeciras. Please advise on the following:

1. How will we communicate with your ship once we are ready to load the cargo?
2. How do you pay your pilot?
3. What will be the weekly rate to pilot your ship?
4. Do you have a safety system on board?

Regards,
Captain Schuppe

email_chain.subject: Pilot Availability and Safety Systems
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Captain Schuppe,

Your offer to pilot our vessel, as well as the details regarding the safety systems, checklist, and safety instructions, were all well received. I have passed these on to our client. However, there is an issue we had not discussed yet, and we would like to get this sorted out before proceeding with the rest of your request.

It appears that our regular pilot cannot make it to the port, and we were wondering if you would be available to pilot our vessel on July 1st.

With respect,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Pilot Unavailability Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Captain Schuppe,

On June 30th, the port pilot for our vessel was unable to go to Rotterdam. We have no idea how long this issue will last, however, we are in the midst of our planning phase. We will know more once we have information from the cargo owners and our client. Please do not delay.

Regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Capacity and C&F Price
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Sam,

This is a quick email to ask if you can handle a small shipment of 450MT of vegetable oil from Dublin to Hankook (in Korea) for next Thursday. Do you have the capacity?

I was hoping to finalize the details by this Friday to ensure dispatch by next Monday. Could you provide an indicative C&F price?

Please advise.

Thank you,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Feedback on Software
email_chain.body:
Dear Sam,

The software is really nice. I have used it in over 2,000 deals. It is the best website for finding carriers.

Thanks,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Access to Best Sea Freight Quotes
email_chain.body: Please note that as a member of ShippyPro, we can access the best quotes available for international sea freight.

email_chain.subject: Introduction to ITMS Services
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I'm writing on behalf of International Transport Management Services (ITMS). We are an Asian broker based out of Dubai, United Arab Emirates, with 20 years of experience in the logistics and transport industry. We specialize in handling cargo for international suppliers. We ship products to Dubai, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Oman, Kuwait, and India. We have extensive experience working with major LCL consolidators and airfreight forwarders, as well as small and large groups of consolidators. In short, we are more than capable of meeting your logistics needs.

Best regards,
ITMS Team

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. White,

We have 4,500MT of FCL to ship from Mombasa to Dar Es Salaam. Can you accommodate our partial window between 9:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. on 4/28?

Please send me your best rate.

Thanks,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Sure, I can accommodate your shipment. The current CBM rate is $225/MT. There will be a 1.5% NVOCC charge, which amounts to $2,125 x 4.5 tonnes, totaling $950.85. Additionally, there is a $5 USD fee for loading and unloading.

I can guarantee that we will move the cargo on the same day by Monday.

Kind regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Milt,

We are still waiting for your response regarding the U.S. Presidential elections. Please advise by Monday.

Thanks,
Cassie

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Cassie,

Thank you for your email dated 23/10/19. Your party won the most number of seats in the recent U.S. elections and you have been asked to form the government. This was one of the most keenly contested elections in history, and your party has the ability to form a majority in the U.S. House of Representatives.

In response to your email, your party plans to use the $100,000 gift from the Party Unity Coalition to fundraise for the initial payrolls of employees and contractors in the new government. Additionally, we will contribute a further $50,000 each month for a period of 4 months.

My boss has also offered to fundraise a further $500,000 and to make this contribution and future contributions tax-deductible. However, given that the U.S. has no tax system, we will need to clarify this further.

Best regards,
Milt

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Milt,

Thanks for your email. It is nice to be having a two-way communication about this matter.

As requested, I am sending you an attached email with details and contact information for the Party Unity Coalition. I will be sure to follow up with them and keep you in the loop regarding any developments.

Let me know if you have any other questions, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,
Cassie

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Cassie,

Thank you for your email dated 30/10/19. I have attached the email correspondence with Mr. Marcus Barnes from the Party Unity Coalition.

The financial arrangement we will be undertaking is as follows: the Party Unity Coalition will raise an initial $50,000 each month for 4 months, followed by an additional $50,000 each month for the subsequent 3 months. Thereafter, contributions will be $50,000 each month for the following 3 months. Total contributions will amount to $220,000.

These contributions will be used to fundraise for the initial payrolls of employees and contractors in the new government and to cover subsequent months. Given that the U.S. has no tax system, I have asked Mr. Barnes to make this contribution and future contributions tax-deductible. Additionally, my boss has offered to contribute further.

Best regards,
Milt

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Milt,

Thanks for getting back to me. I have forwarded your email to my manager, Inga. I can confirm that our company will make a contribution of $500,000 to support your election campaign as you had hoped. We will also make the contribution tax-deductible. I have attached the email with the details of the funds and contributions that we plan to make.

Best regards,
Cassie

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Cassie,

Your team has raised $220,000 from the Party Unity Coalition. I will be sending an invoice to the Coalition to confirm the arrangement and look forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,
Milt

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on U.S. Presidential Elections
email_chain.body:
Hi Milt,

Thanks for getting back to me. Please accept our invoice for $220,000 (including $50,000 to be distributed over the next 4 months). We would like to make the payment as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Cassie

email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bernard,

I need you to ship 1,200 MT of gasoline to Tripoli from your company. We have a contract with another company that is providing us with 2,400 MT for our needs, but we did not receive the full amount due to the delay in transportation, and we only have the means to buy what we have in our budget. We will have to stop the buying and do something about the current shortage of fuel, and so, I have made an immediate order of 1,200 MT that I would like you to deliver.

I hope you will be able to help us and deliver the fuel immediately.

Thank you,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Concerns About Delivery Delays
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bernard,

I know you are trying to do your best, but I would like to talk to you about the time that is needed for the shipping and delivering of the fuel. My company needs to continue the imports of fuel because of the winter weather and also because of the heat wave. Unfortunately, the delay in the delivery of the fuel is really harming our business. Could you please think of something that you can do to avoid the delays? I think you understand what I am trying to say because your company is also in the same line of business that we are in.

Thank you for listening,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Sangwoo,

We’re looking to discharge an LTL container at Rotterdam on the 27th, and transit it to London with a FTL 20-footer. Could you quote a warehouse at London to receive the container on the 30th?

Regards,
Mikhail

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mikhail,

I can manage this request, but I am concerned about handling the shipment at the last minute, especially if there is a discrepancy in our order timeline.

Regards,
Miki

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Hi Miki,

I tried to proceed with this, but my co-workers are saying it’s too expensive. I’m feeling very disappointed.

Regards,
Julia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Hello Julia,

I’ve sent an email to your other address that should address this. Since they didn’t respond to you, they might not see it as a priority. Unfortunately, the company structure often requires manager-level involvement for urgent matters. However, you could try to convince them that working with someone younger and more flexible might be a better solution. This is a great opportunity for you, and I’m sorry you don’t have the authority to push this forward.

Regards,
Miki

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Good morning Miki,

We’re looking to discharge an LTL container at Rotterdam on the 27th, and transit it to London with a FTL 20-footer. Could you quote a warehouse at London to receive the container on the 30th?

Regards,
Mikhail

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Hello Mikhail,

We can proceed if you make a booking immediately. Please confirm the order, and I will provide the price and date.

Regards,
Miki

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Warehouse Quote in London
email_chain.body:
Hi Miki,

Mikhail wasn’t satisfied with your reply because he wanted the project to be carried out at a lower price. My co-worker chose this strategy because Mikhail isn’t a manager. I believe higher management should engage with decision-makers rather than younger employees.

Regards,
Julia

email_chain.subject: Happy 2025!
email_chain.body:
Hello Eric,

As our customers all around the world may have noticed, we are introducing a new range of wooden Lego. We think they are going to be a huge hit with your children.

We are offering a special 20% discount for any purchases above 1 million Lego units. The special promotion expires on January 3rd, so hurry!

Best wishes,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Notice
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

With the potential benefits of wood, we have been working with a major partner in China to set up a wood business. After they produce the raw materials, we need to process them into a nice and reasonable shape.

Some kids will have wooden Lego, and some will have plastic ones. The problem is that some wooden Legos may accidentally hurt a child's skin or face. We have set up a quality check platform and sent 500 Legos to a certified laboratory to see whether the wooden Lego poses a threat to children.

The results showed that the Legos are as safe as the plastic ones. Therefore, it is definitely the right time to go to market. We are 100% sure that the wooden Lego is safe, non-toxic, non-irritating, and durable.

As

email_chain.subject: Natural
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

After the distribution of the wooden Legos in China, we are still receiving requests from European countries. These countries include Germany, France, Austria, the Netherlands, and others.

We are happy to know that our wooden Lego is in high demand, and we cannot help but make some strategies to bring wooden Legos to more countries.

After some communications, we are here with a message for you. We will introduce an agent for wooden Legos to bring these products to other countries. These agents have a huge influence on products such as wooden Legos. We hope that the two parties can work together well and make a profit.

We are more than happy to offer a 20% commission to those agents who are able to sign contracts with us.

Thanks a lot.

Sincerely,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Urgent Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
I am urgently shipping several spare parts from Los Angeles to Hamburg. The total weight is 2,800MT and 27mm oversized shipping, with earliest arrival next week. Could you provide your best estimate, ASAP?

Sincerely,
Calvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you for reaching out. We'd be glad to offer you a quote with the possible transportation method for your packages.

For this transportation, we would need the following information about your packages:
- The number of packages
- The weight per package
- The size of your package
- The location of your package departure

We will also need the pick-up place of your packages and the arrival port. All this information will help us find the most suitable way to transport your packages.

Please send the specific information to: sales@myfuckingcompany.com.

I am currently on my way to California, so my contact data are still unavailable, but I will call you back in two days from now.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Calvin,

Thank you for sending the above information. We have received and discussed the package details with our logistics team. We can offer you two options:

1. **Air Freight (via DHL Air Courier):**
   - Ideal for time-sensitive packages: Air freight is the fastest option.
   - Requires an agent to pick up packages. Some of our agents have storage facilities in their warehouses if needed.
   - The exact arrival time is not guaranteed; delays can occur up to 24 hours. Drivers may not always stay at the delivery address for the entire pick-up time (please confirm with the agent when sending the packages).
   - Air freight is generally more expensive than sea freight.

2. **Sea Freight:**
   - Cost-effective for large shipments.
   - Longer transit time compared to air freight.

Please let us know which option suits your needs, and we will proceed accordingly.

Best regards,
Sales Team

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Ross,

Do you remember the delivery incident of Ethanol from Vigo to Fos sur Mer? It would be best to prepare the load list and schedule to avoid similar occurrences in the future.

Best regards,
Rory

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: Yes, I remember it very well. I would like to know what went wrong and what lessons we can draw from it. Most importantly, how do we ensure there will be no similar incident in the future? We would like to avoid repeating that error, especially with respect to environmental hazards.

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body:
My team will examine the incident carefully and get back to you. However, our aim should be to minimize similar situations, and our goal should be to minimize risks and have accident-free operations. Our organization should be committed to environmental safety as we all have a responsibility to protect our planet.

Best,
Rory

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: Well, we cannot depend on individuals alone; our systems are equally important. We should have systems in place to ensure that employees act correctly. Our goal should be to ensure safety and avoid errors in the future.

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: I have come across many errors in the process and many other instances where similar mistakes occurred. We should have a mechanism to prevent such errors.

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: Yes, it is very true. Our goal should be to have a mechanism to prevent such errors. We should strive to avoid errors. However, our systems should not be the only fault-finding.

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: I remember that the reports were found only after a couple of weeks. My question is, what caused the delay?

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: It is our responsibility to do so. We need to check for any errors that can be prevented. Our goal should be to minimize errors and to have accident-free operations.

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Ethanol Delivery Incident
email_chain.body: The reason for the delay in detecting such errors is the same as in other organizations. It happens due to the nature of the job. The employees do not always have the tools or processes in place to catch these issues in time.
