email_chain.subject: Request for Bareboat Charter Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Frank,

Thank you for sending us the latest request for bareboat charter rates. We are very interested in obtaining a price for a late-week sail from Tianjin to Shekou on the 28th of this month. We are planning to use the tanks to move crude oil, and for this shipment, we would require 10,000 MT.

Best regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Oil Tank Charter
email_chain.body:
Dear Nick,

Thank you for your email. We were initially unclear about the specifics of the oil tank charter. Specifically, we were unsure whether we were to supply empty tanks and load the crude, or load the tanks at our port and deliver them to your port. We have now received your request and are interested in moving 50% of the crude (see attached).

However, we need to ensure that we are clear on the terms and conditions. Could you please provide more details on these? Additionally, we have received interest from another shipowner for the same sailing and timeframe. Please advise us as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Oil Tanker Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Frank,

Thank you for your prompt response. To clarify, my previous request referred to chartering an oil tanker for this delivery. We require assistance in connecting with a company that can supply the crude and provide a vessel to supply our tankers (specifically the PCTC FEDRA REY) with this crude. We are not interested in owning or renting the tanker for an extended period.

Could you confirm if your company can accommodate these terms? Please let us know if this request poses any difficulties.

Best regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Additional Product Requirement
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Please add the following product to our requirements: Petrochemical, 1,000 MT at the rate of US $13.50/MT.

Best regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Charter Rate Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Nick,

We are interested in filling the rates for the 50,000 MT of crude for the following sale and will start negotiations based on those:

Charter Rate 1 - 50,000 MT crude, 5,000 MT soybeans, under charter at US $23,000 per day (charter without any options). The only condition of this charter is that we start loading by Wednesday, 27th of January at 07:00 hrs and finish by Saturday, 30th of January, before 22:00 hrs.

Please let me know if this is acceptable to you.

Best regards,
Frank

labels.cargo_size: 50,000 MT crude, 5,000 MT soybeans, 1,000 MT petrochemical

email_chain.subject: Freighter Perla de Panama Loading Inquiry
email_chain.body: Hi Jimmy, On May 23, the freighter Perla de Panama will call at Houston for a 10-minute loading. I'd like to ask if the shipper is ready for loading and if any special requirements are needed.

email_chain.subject: Additional Order for Mosaico

email_chain.subject: Emergency Due to Heavy Rain
email_chain.body: Hi Jimmy, I'm sorry to report that we are facing an emergency. The heavy rain last weekend has left our yard in an awful mess. We need to move some cargo to the warehouse to continue with the clearing. The box X45678 must be moved to the warehouse, then it will be forwarded to you.

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Forward Box X45678
email_chain.body: Dear Jimmy, The box named X45678 should be forwarded to its final destination as soon as possible. Here is the latest information: the weather is clear in all the locations. The forecast is good until mid-July.

email_chain.subject: Special Offer on Mosaico Items
email_chain.body: Dear Jimmy, It is my pleasure to offer you a 50% discount on the line items Mosaico X45678 and Mosaico X34567. Your new order will be ready for loading tomorrow.

email_chain.subject: Transport Options and Schedule Impact
email_chain.body:
Hi Rory,

I just reviewed the transport options, and I understand how challenging it is to find the perfect solution for you. The delay to our ship is significantly impacting our schedule.

Could you please give me a call? It would be easier and faster than exchanging emails. You can reach me at my office number: 2033-xxxxxxx. My office hours are from 0800 to 1700. Do you have any availability during these hours?

Best regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Options and Schedule Impact
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Jonas.

I’m currently on my way to a meeting and won’t be able to step out. I’ll call you back next week, either Tuesday or Wednesday, when I’m back in the office. If you don’t hear from me by then, it means I’m unable to assist further. Otherwise, we can arrange a time to speak.

My office hours are from 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM, so feel free to call me during that window if you have any urgent questions.

I’ll confirm the exact time for our call closer to the date.

Best,
Rory

email_chain.subject: Request for Extra Day and Best Rate for Ethanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Chao,

I have received your quotation, but I would like to request an extra day as load restrictions will prevent us from sailing immediately. Could you provide your best rate for 10,500MT of ethanol ready for shipment from Aqaba to Busan? The vessel can only sail in 4 days' time.

Thank you,
Jan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Extra Day and Best Rate for Ethanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Jan,

We will schedule the sailing of our VLCC bulker before the middle of next week. Currently, we do not have an extra day available, but we can accommodate an extra day at very short notice if needed. If a day becomes available, we will inform you in advance.

I believe you can secure a better rate without the extra day. Additionally, we appreciate your cooperation in the necessary load procedures for loading VLCC cargoes. We have received several vessels from Busan with less than 100% ballast, and we need to reduce ballast on our last vessel to ensure sufficient load margins for the remaining cargo. This is why we cannot load the minimum ballast for our chemical vessel.

Please note that if your cargo is close to expiry and must be held, we will need to adjust accordingly.

Best regards,
Ms. Chao

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Ethanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Felix,

Thank you for your latest information. However, the tanks are already loaded with a cargo (last gas cargo) of 80% and will hold until the next load. Do you have a suitable rate for now?

Best regards,
Jan

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Ethanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jan,

I can only provide you with the best rate if I know your cargo characteristics. However, I believe you will receive a lower rate if we handle the bunker for your voyage. We will transport your product to Busan on a confirmed VLCC Bulker (as per your request) and bunker from Busan to Aqaba. After that, you can either pay for the bunker or proceed yourself. You will need to add a discount for bunker oil at Busan.

If you wish, I can start our bunker and sailing arrangements to make an available space of approximately 5,500MT.

Best regards,
Felix

email_chain.subject: Response to Your Inquiry on Grain Availability
email_chain.body:

Anoop

email_chain.body:

- July to September 2022: 4,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
- October 2022 through December 2022: 2,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
- January 2023 through March 2023: 3,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay
- April 2023 through June 2023: 3,000MT per month, FOB Uruguay

In July and December 2022, we will offer 100MT per month. The shipping will be under 35 days from the date of order, with FOB Uruguay.

As mentioned, the first trial has...

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Sugar Oil Supply
email_chain.body:
Dearest Joe,

I am very pleased to respond to your query regarding the supply of 2,000MT of sugar oil. We propose to supply you with 4,000MT per month (1,000MT of sugar and 3,000MT of oil) for the next five months, from July 2022 to November 2022.

The sugar is available from July to December 2022, and the oil will be available from January to June 2023. However, we would like to bring your attention to the cost difference between July to September and October to December.

- In July to September, the cost of sugar oil will be at USD 2.25 per liter.
- In October to December, it will be at USD 2.30 per liter.

Also, for the sugar orders, the price in USD 4.00 per...

email_chain.subject: Further Discussion on Sugar Oil Supply
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for reaching out to us for sugar oil. As mentioned in our email, we can supply sugar oil in 2,000MT per month for the period of July to September 2022. However, we are also interested in exploring the possibility of expanding our supply to 4,000MT per month for the next 5 months from October 2022 to February 2023.

Additionally, if you can provide us with a minimum order of 100MT per month, we would be happy to discuss the terms and conditions.

Looking forward to your reply,

With best regards,
Managing Director

Thank you for accepting the documents and acknowledging my previous emails. I would like to apologize for the delay in my responses. My contract with the supplier of dry fruits expired, and I could not replace him. This took several weeks and made me very busy. However, I have decided to go back to the same supplier. I have already ordered 200 kilos of raisins. Please let me know when you have received the invoice and the shipment.

Thank you,
Abdul

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Biodiesel Shipping from Singapore to Yangon
email_chain.body:

I am interested in shipping 7,200MT of biodiesel from Singapore to Yangon. Do you handle bunkers on owners’ account, and can you accommodate a 3-day laycan extension?

Thank you,
Elise

email_chain.subject: Terms and Conditions from Producers
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Xander,

As promised, here’s the full terms and conditions from the producers. We’ll need to discuss with the freight forwarder if this is fine with them, or if we need to update the contract to have them sign as well.

I’ll see you soon.

Regards,
Elise

email_chain.subject: Re: Terms and Conditions from Producers
email_chain.body:
Hi Elise,

Thanks for sending over the terms and conditions from the producers. It looks like they’re fine with us to go ahead with the contract, and we don’t need to update the contract. However, we’ll need to wait until next week to discuss with the freight forwarder and let you know what they say.

We’ll talk soon.

Regards,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Updates from Freight Forwarder
email_chain.body:
Hi Xander,

It’s me again. I have some updates from the freight forwarder for you. We would like to discuss with the producer about increasing the delivery date to 28th of June. Additionally, we would like the terms and conditions updated with their freight forwarder to match ours, since they handle the entire cargo from production until shipment. I would be happy to send over a draft for your approval.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regards,
Elise

email_chain.subject: Re: Updates from Freight Forwarder
email_chain.body:
Hi Elise,

We have agreed to move the delivery date to the 28th of June, and we’ll update the terms and conditions accordingly. We’ll draft a new contract with the freight forwarder and send it to you for your review.

I’ll see you soon.

Regards,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Updated Contract with Freight Forwarder
email_chain.body:
Hi Elise,

The updated contract with the freight forwarder is ready. Could you please let me know if we can use the attachment?

Regards,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Contract with Freight Forwarder
email_chain.body:
Hi Xander,

Thanks for your review of the contract. It looks good to me, and we can use the attachment.

I’ll see you soon.

Regards,
Elise

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Contract with Freight Forwarder
email_chain.body:
Hi Elise,

Thank you for your agreement on the contract. We’ll need to send this to the producer and freight forwarder to sign.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regards,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Signed Contracts from Producer and Freight Forwarder
email_chain.body:
Hi Elise,

Here are the signed contracts from the producer and the freight forwarder. I’ll send over the signed contracts to the producer as well.

Regards,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Re: Signed Contracts from Producer and Freight Forwarder

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regards,
Xander

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Car Transport to Copenhagen - Issue
email_chain.body: I have just received confirmation regarding the car transporter to Copenhagen. Unfortunately, we are unable to transport the car from Rotterdam as the lead time is too short, and the shipper requires it to be transported next week. Could you advise on a suitable alternative carrier? Best regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transport to Copenhagen - Issue
email_chain.body: I would be most grateful if you could let me know of any options for transporting this vehicle from Rotterdam to Copenhagen. I was surprised to hear that it would not be possible to transport it next week. Regards, Bill

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transport to Copenhagen - Issue
email_chain.body: Bill, I am very sorry that I cannot help you with this. The van carrying the car has just left Rotterdam. I have contacted our contacts in Rotterdam to check if there is a chance to send this car to Copenhagen. I will get back to you as soon as possible. Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transport to Copenhagen - Issue
email_chain.body: I am afraid I cannot help you this time, Bill. We have the car in our facility in Rotterdam. We can offer you some storage options and also export the car to Denmark. The export process would take approximately a week. Would you be interested? Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transport to Copenhagen - Update
email_chain.body: I would like to inform you that we have picked up the car from Rotterdam, and it is now en route to Denmark. It will arrive at the port of Copenhagen at about 11:00 next Tuesday morning. I hope this makes up for the inconvenience caused by not transporting the car on the original date. Regards, Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Car Transport to Copenhagen - Arrival
email_chain.body: I am very pleased to inform you that your car arrived on Tuesday morning at 11:00. The driver has taken your car to your home and is waiting for you there. I have also sent a notification via text message so that you would know the car was in Copenhagen. Regards, Anders

I have a crew with five MT capacity, which they can load by crane. Could you advise when you can perform your bulk product discharge? Additionally, I can recommend a supplier in Aqaba if needed.

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Acid Anhydride Cargo Rate
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kamhi,

We are currently working on a 6,000MT cargo of acid anhydride from New Orleans to Saudi Arabia. Could you provide a standard rate if we finalize on Tuesday?

Thanks,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Acid Anhydride Cargo Rate
email_chain.body:
Hi Bobby,

It will cost $25 per MT, FOB New Orleans. The freight rates for the 40' FP container would be about $1400. The ocean freight could be spread over 16 weeks, so I would expect to see your cargo 16 weeks from now, if I do not get an early payment for the freight.

However, the standard practice here is to allow the buyer to get a spot rate, which, I have noted, is 28% higher than our price. The seller is hoping to make the spot rate, but does not have the luxury of counting on it. The buyer might not find a spot rate, or might not be able to pay for it. So, that is why I am asking you to call me on Tuesday and get a standard price.

Let me know if you need any further information.

Best regards,
Ron

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Acid Anhydride Cargo Rate
email_chain.body:
Hi Ron,

Thanks for your email. I will forward this to the client. Hope to hear from you later.

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Request for Steerage Bill
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Adarsh,

Could you please arrange for a steerage bill from Chicago to the port of London? Let me know if you need any further details.

Thanks for your help,
Roger

email_chain.subject: Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
Hi Roger,

Here's the bill of lading. Please sign and initial it. The cost is $1000, and I will reimburse you accordingly.

On a lighter note, the worst present I received was a pie and pastry from San Francisco. They were terrible, and I hope you're not planning to bring anything similar to our table!

Have a nice Christmas.

Regards,
Ms. Adarsh

email_chain.subject: Re: Bill of Lading
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Adarsh,

Thanks for sending the bill of lading. The steerage fares from Chicago to the port of London are indeed $1000. I hope you're getting the recipe for the pie you're trying to create right this time!

1. Product: Polypropylene Powder
2. Test Method: ICP-OES
3. Temperature Range: 50C - 100C
4. Vacuum: A vacuum of < 10^–4 Torr is required during analysis.
5. Heating: Time and Temp is required for the calcination process.

If the above specifications are possible, we would be willing to place an order. Kindly advise your team on this.

Kind regards,
Eva

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Urea Shipment from Dubai to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Good morning Patrick,

We are currently planning to move 12,500MT of urea from Dubai to Jakarta next month. Could you advise if we will need to charter a full vessel to transport this amount?

Best regards,
Penny

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Urea Shipment from Dubai to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Hello Penny,

Transporting 12,500MT in a single shipment depends on several factors:
1) The maximum weight capacity of the vessel, which varies by type (e.g., tanker, bulk carrier).
2) The density and type of material being transported.
3) The stowage space available, which can vary based on the vessel's design.

For urea, which is a bulk commodity, you might not necessarily need a full vessel, but it depends on the specific vessel's capacity and configuration. I recommend consulting with a shipping broker to get precise details.

Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Additional Information on Bulk Commodity Transport
email_chain.body:
Hello Penny,

I wanted to provide some additional context on bulk commodity transport. For example, in the case of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG), there are three main types of tankers:
A) Single Deck (LNG vessels),
B) Double Deck (LPG carriers),
C) Truck Tankers (for road transport).

Each type has specific considerations, such as capacity, design, and operational requirements. While urea transport is different, understanding these factors can help in planning your shipment.

Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Pallet Shipping from China to North America
email_chain.body:
Good morning Patrick,

I'm currently considering the transportation of pallets from China to a location in North America. Before proceeding with the order, I need to know the estimated cost per shipment. Could you provide some guidance?

Thank you,
Mika

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Pallet Shipping from China to North America
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your message, Mika.

Shipping pallets from China to North America typically involves maritime transport through routes like the Panama Canal. For a pallet of 4 m², the estimated cost to Los Angeles is around US$200 per shipment (equivalent to US$80 per cubic metre).

If you need more specific details or have additional questions, feel free to reach out.

Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.body:

Best regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Initial Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Beth,

Thank you for your email and interest. We've reviewed your application and need some additional details to process your request. Here are the required items:
1. Provide your PAYE reference.
2. Provide an assessment of your position.
3. Provide a signed employment contract.
4. Provide a signed Confidentiality and Non-Competition Agreement.

If you have the necessary information, we can assist you immediately.

Best regards,
Mr. Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Initial Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Beth,

I wanted to follow up on our conversation. We've reviewed the information you've provided and need a few more things to process your request:
1. Please provide a signed employment contract.
2. Please provide a signed Confidentiality and Non-Competition Agreement.

If you have the necessary information, we can proceed. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
Mr. Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Initial Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Smith,

Thank you for your email. I have a few questions:
1. Can you please provide a copy of the employment contract or a signed copy if you have it?
2. Have you previously completed a signed employment contract, or is there a copy available?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Beth

email_chain.subject: Request for ETA of the 17th Vessel from Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

Would you please provide us with the latest information about the ETA of the 17th vessel out of Antwerp?

Have a nice day,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on ETA of the 17th Vessel from Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

A quick note to follow-up on the recent communication regarding the ETA of the 17th vessel out of Antwerp. I was hoping to receive an update from you on the ETA of the vessel before we proceed with our plans.

Kind regards,
Anna

email_chain.subject: Update on ETA of the 17th Vessel from Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria and Anna,

As mentioned in our previous email, we were hoping to receive an update on the ETA of the 17th vessel out of Antwerp. I've followed up with the carrier on this matter and have received the following information:

- The vessel left Antwerp on March 12th and is currently en route to our port.
- We expect the vessel to arrive on April 2nd, 2023.
- We have the ETA for each of the cargo loads.

We'd appreciate it if you could provide us with an update on the ETA of the vessel.

Kind regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on ETA of the 17th Vessel from Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

I hope this email finds you well. As we are expecting a cargo shipment from Antwerp, we need to have an ETA for the vessel that will be arriving in our port. We were hoping to receive an update on the 17th vessel out of Antwerp, but unfortunately, we have not received any information on the vessel's ETA yet. We would appreciate it if you could provide us with an update on the ETA of the vessel.

Thank you for your time.

Kind regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for Solvents Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Stevenson,

We need a vessel for 8,000MT of solvents from the US Gulf to Petronella. Do you have any available? We would like to see a fixed demurrage rate as this is being invoiced in USD.

Thank you,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Solvents Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Adrian,

Please forward your PO to our logistics manager David. He will get back to you on this within 24 hours.

Thanks,
Stevenson

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Solvents Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Adrian,

Thank you for your proposal. It is favorable for us, but unfortunately, this shipment is very urgent. There are no other vessels available at the moment. So I have booked this shipment on DNV Sparrow. We have to pay 3,000 USD demurrage, which will be added to your invoice.

Please get back to us when you have the FFO, draft, and deadweight of Sparrow.

Thank you,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Re: DNV Sparrow Details
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thanks for your response. DNV Sparrow is on the Gulf to Petronella and will be arriving in two days. The information we have received is as follows:

FFO is 24,192 cubic feet
Draft is 16.5 feet
Deadweight is 2,000MT

Thank you for your help!
Kind regards,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Re: FFA Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Adrian,

Thank you for your quotation. Please forward your FFA to my attention.

Thank you,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Re: DNV Sparrow Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Adrian,

Thanks for your help! Our FFO is 48,000 cubic feet. 47.8 for deadweight. I have already paid to DNV Sparrow. We are expecting this vessel in a week. You can please add DNV Sparrow 1,000 USD demurrage in our final invoice.

Regards,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Delivery Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Adrian,

Thank you for your quotation. We have 24,000 cubic feet of FFO. We need it delivered urgently. We would like to have a fixed demurrage rate.

Regards,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Graphite Shipment from Dalian to Nakhon
email_chain.body:
We will be sending 2,000MT of graphite from Dalian to Nakhon. Given the recent weather conditions, could you please confirm if this material requires heat shielding for future shipments?

Best regards,
Ju

email_chain.subject: Re: Graphite Shipment from Dalian to Nakhon
email_chain.body:
Dear Ju,

Yes, the material we are handling from the loading port is already 100% heat shielded. Please ensure it remains that way, and we will take care of the rest.

Best regards,
Jim

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Proposal - Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello,

We need a vessel for 10,000MT of gasoline from Houston to the Canary Islands. Could you provide your preference on laycan and demurrage conditions, and what’s your lumpsum freight idea?

Thank you,
Amber

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Proposal - Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Amber,

Thank you for your inquiry. Please find below the information requested for the Car Trader’s proposal:

Per car specifications:
- Length: 4.7 m
- Weight: 2,500 kg
- Fuel consumption: 2 l/100 km
- Horsepower: 100 kW
- Sufficient to carry up to 9 passengers
- Dimensions: 3.6 m x 1.6 m x 1.9 m

This is our offer:
- Fuel consumption: 3 l/100 km
- LCOE: $15.36

This includes the complete car from port to port, plus limited insurance for theft or damages at the port.

If the client wishes to add passengers or cargo, please contact us again. We can make this offer applicable to the particular situation.

In case of any additional questions, please don’t hesitate to get back to me.

Best regards,
Car Trader

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Proposal - Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Car Trader,

Thank you for your prompt reply. Our client is interested in your offer. We will contact you as soon as we have the customer’s confirmation.

Regards,
Amber

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Zara,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the potential shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. Here is a preliminary freight indication:

Based on the current market rates and port-to-port tonnage (440 mt/unit), our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam.

We hope this information is helpful. If you have any other questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to me.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. David,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the purchase of bulk corn starch from Thailand. We would like to provide you with a freight quote for your shipment from the Port of Bangkok to Haiphong. Our base rate for this shipment is $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. Please note that this rate is based on the current market conditions and can be adjusted based on the specific requirements of your shipment. The following is the detailed cost breakdown for your reference:

- Inland delivery from our terminal in Bangkok to the specified destination, including any applicable duties and taxes: $550 USD/mt
- Port-to-port shipping charges: $77 USD/mt
- Customs clearance and handling fees: $8 USD/mt
- Total freight rate for 440 MT of bulk corn starch: $115 USD/mt

If you have any questions or require further assistance, please let us know.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. David,

Please accept our apologies for the delay in responding to your inquiry regarding the shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. We appreciate your patience as we worked to address your concerns and provide you with a reliable and accurate freight quote.

Based on the current market rates and port-to-port tonnage (440 mt/unit), our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. However, due to the significant rise in the cost of fuel and other related expenses, we have revised our freight rate for this shipment to $125 USD/mt, effective immediately. This adjustment is to ensure that we can provide our clients with a reliable and cost-effective solution for their transportation needs.

We understand that this increase may be a concern, but we believe that it is necessary to maintain the quality of our service. If you have any questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to me.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Updated Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. David,

We have received your request for a freight quote for the shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. Our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $115 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. However, due to the current market volatility and the rising cost of transportation, we have revised our freight rate for this shipment to $125 USD/mt, effective immediately. This adjustment is to ensure that we can provide our clients with a reliable and cost-effective solution for their transportation needs.

If you have any questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to me. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Updated Freight Quote for Bulk Corn Starch Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jane,

Thank you for your prompt reply regarding the shipment of bulk corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong. We appreciate your understanding and are happy to provide you with a revised freight quote. Our standard bulk shipping rates for corn starch from Bangkok to Haiphong are estimated to be $125 USD/mt, including inland delivery in Thailand and Vietnam. We hope this updated rate is more suitable for your needs. Please let us know if you have any questions or require further assistance. We look forward to working with you on this important project.

Kind regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Request for Reroute and Shipment Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mendoza,

I request a reroute for 2,000MT of gasoline from Montego Bay to Tangier. Additionally, please confirm availability and laycan slots for the following port-to-port shipments:

1. 1,000MT from Charleston to Houston
2. 3,000MT from Jacksonville to New York

Best regards,
Kelvin

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Reroute and Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mendoza,

Thank you for your emails of 15 May and 16 May. The reroute of 2,000MT of gasoline from Montego Bay to Tangier has been fully coordinated with our supplier, and I appreciate the quick turnaround time of two days. I am also pleased to confirm the availability and laycan slots for the two port-to-port shipments:

1. 1,000MT from Charleston to Houston
2. 3,000MT from Jacksonville to New York

These shipments are scheduled for delivery on 29 June. Thank you again for your assistance.

Best regards,
Kelvin

email_chain.subject: Appreciation for Logistics Execution
email_chain.body:
Dear Mendoza,

I am writing to express my satisfaction with your firm’s performance in executing the logistics for the gasoline shipments in May. The process was smooth, and I look forward to working with your firm again in the future. Thank you for your hard work.

Best regards,
Kelvin

email_chain.subject: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Manu,

I need to find a cargo vessel for an urgent shipment of 9,000MT of rubidium from New York to Port Klang. Please quote me a very fast vessel, and our preferred laycan date would be the 21st.

Thank you,
Vera

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Vera has requested an urgent shipment of 9,000MT of rubidium from New York to Port Klang with a laycan date of the 21st. Could you please provide a quote for a fast vessel that can meet this requirement?

Best Regards,
Manu

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Manu,

The vessel 'SR MAXIMUS' can deliver your cargo from New York to Port Klang on the 21st. I have attached a detailed itinerary for your review.

Best Regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Thanks for your quick reply. We would like to keep the cargo as urgent as possible, and we are looking for a vessel that can deliver it to Port Klang on the 21st, ideally with a laycan date of the 21st as well. Our budget is 120,000 USD. Please let us know if you can provide such a service for us.

Best Regards,
Manu

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Vera,

Please note that the 'SR MAXIMUS' can deliver your cargo on the 21st.

Best Regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Thank you so much for your message. We are very pleased with your offer. Could you please confirm this availability to me, as well as your laycan date? If all these terms are satisfactory to you, we would like to sign an online BL as soon as possible.

Best Regards,
Vera

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Cargo Vessel Request for Rubidium
email_chain.body:
Hi Vera,

This is great news. I will proceed immediately with the booking and I’ll email you the invoice.

Have a nice day,
Nick
